Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Finally, Paris’s many splendid covered passages are of architectural interest and reserved for pedestrians. Real gems to discover, anytime."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://parisjetaime.com/eng/article/pedestrianized-areas-of-paris-a002

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: The Parc Rives de Seine provides ten hectares of quayside space dedicated to pedestrians and non-motorized users such as cyclists, rollerbladers, and scooter riders.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Ten hectares of quaysides have been developed for pedestrians and non-motorized vehicles (bikes, rollerblades, scooters, etc.)."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://parisjetaime.com/eng/article/pedestrianized-areas-of-paris-a002

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Certain districts including Montmartre, the Marais, and Canal Saint-Martin are closed to cars on Sundays and public holidays, becoming temporarily reserved for pedestrians and non-motorized users.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "‘Paris Respire’ areas closed to cars on Sundays and public holidays, they enable everyone to enjoy traffic-free and noise-free streets. Don’t miss the opportunity to explore the districts of Montmartre, the Marais and the Canal Saint-Martin, when they are the sole preserve of walkers on these days!"
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://parisjetaime.com/eng/article/pedestrianized-areas-of-paris-a002

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: On the first Sunday of each month, the Avenue des Champs-Élysées is fully closed to motorized traffic and opened exclusively to pedestrians.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "On the 1st Sunday of the month, the entire length of the famous Avenue des Champs-Elysées is given over to pedestrians."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://parisjetaime.com/eng/article/pedestrianized-areas-of-paris-a002

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: During the first Sunday of every month, the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th arrondissements of Paris are almost entirely closed to motor vehicles, prioritizing pedestrian access.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Every first Sunday of the month, pedestrians can also take advantage of the almost-total pedestrianization of the capital’s 1st, 2nd, 3rd and 4th arrondissements."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://parisjetaime.com/eng/article/pedestrianized-areas-of-paris-a002

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: French driving rules may differ from other EU countries in areas such as blood alcohol limits, speed limits, required safety equipment for drivers and cyclists, mandatory use of daytime headlights or winter tires, and left-hand driving (though France drives on the right).
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les pays de l’UE peuvent appliquer des règles différentes dans de nombreux domaines, tels que le taux d'alcoolémie autorisé (certains pays appliquent une tolérance zéro); les limites de vitesse selon le type de routes et de véhicules; les équipements de sécurité requis pour les cyclistes et les automobilistes; l'utilisation obligatoire des phares en plein jour et/ou des pneus d'hiver; la conduite à gauche (à Chypre, en Irlande et à Malte)."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/travel/driving-abroad/road-rules-and-safety/index_fr.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: In France, wearing seat belts is mandatory for all vehicle occupants, including those in buses and minibuses.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "le port de la ceinture de sécurité est obligatoire dans tous les véhicules, y compris les autocars et les minibus;"
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/travel/driving-abroad/road-rules-and-safety/index_fr.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Vehicles in France must be equipped with appropriate child restraint systems for young passengers.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "les voitures et les poids-lourds (et, si possible les autres véhicules) doivent être équipés de dispositifs adéquats de retenue pour enfants;"
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/travel/driving-abroad/road-rules-and-safety/index_fr.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: It is illegal to use a handheld mobile phone while driving in France; only hands-free kits are permitted.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "l'utilisation d'un téléphone portable au volant sans kit «mains libres» est interdite."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/travel/driving-abroad/road-rules-and-safety/index_fr.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers must generally stay in the right-most lane unless overtaking or in specific traffic conditions.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Drive on the right-most lane. This rule applies all the time, with two exceptions - In queued traffic, you should stay in your current lane without attempting to change lanes, and drive at the traffic flow speed. - If the right-most lane is reserved for slow vehicles, you should only use it if your speed is below 60 km/h."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Reversing on the motorway is strictly prohibited due to danger; drivers must continue to the next exit if they miss one.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Never reverse on motorway. It is forbidden and extremly dangerous. If you missed an exit or service area, just continue to the next one."
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Driving on the hard shoulder is not allowed under normal circumstances.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Do not drive on the hard shoulder"
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: A driver does not have right of way when changing lanes, regardless of the situation (e.g., entering, exiting, overtaking).
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Remember you do not have priority when changing lane. This rule applies in the following situations - When you are pulling out to overtake - When you are pulling back in after overtaking - When you are entering the motorway from an acceleration lane - When you are leaving a lane reserved for slow vehicles"
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Before changing lanes, drivers must check mirrors, signal intentions, avoid tailgating, and safely return to the original lane after overtaking.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Before changing lane, always take the following precautions - Look in your mirrors to make sure the lane is clear - Use your indicators to warn other motorists of your intention - Don’t approach the vehicle in front too closely before pulling out to overtake - Pull back in after overtaking, using your indicators to warn of the lane-change."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Overtaking is permitted only by moving to the left; after completing the maneuver, drivers must safely return to the right lane.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Only overtake to the left. You are only allowed to overtake vehicles by pulling out to the left. After overtaking, pull back in after making sure there is enough room ahead of the overtaken vehicle."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers must respect the presence and needs of different vehicle types by avoiding actions like encroaching on motorcycle lanes, forcing entry from acceleration lanes, tailgating heavy goods vehicles, or weaving between lanes.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Make proper allowance for other types of vehicle... Specific precautions in this respect include the following - Don’t encroach into a lane occupied by a motorcycle - Don’t force your way onto the motorway from the acceleration lane - Don’t pull in to close ahead to a heavy goods vehicle - Don’t slalom from one lane to another"
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://www.autoroutes.fr/en/regulations.htm

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Speed limits in France vary by road type and are reduced during wet weather.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "French speed limits are 50 km/h in towns, 80 km/h on regular roads, 110 km/h on dual carriageways, and 130 km/h on autoroutes (motorways). These drop by 20 km/h in wet weather."  
  - Location p2===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: At intersections without signage, vehicles coming from the right have priority.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Watch for priorité à droite (priority to the right) at unmarked intersections."  
  - Location p2===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers must yield to vehicles already inside a roundabout unless signs indicate otherwise.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Roundabouts give priority to cars already inside unless marked otherwise."  
  - Location p2===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers must carry a driver's license, vehicle registration, insurance certificate, reflective vest, warning triangle, and breathalyzer kit while driving.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "You must carry your driver's license, vehicle registration, insurance certificate, and a reflective vest. Keep a warning triangle and breathalyzer kit in your car."  
  - Location p3===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers from the UK must adjust their headlights for right-hand traffic when driving in France.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Headlights must be adjusted for right-hand traffic if you're from the UK."  
  - Location p3===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Toll roads accept both cash and cards, with specific lanes designated for card-only payments.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Toll roads (péages) accept cash and cards. Look for lanes marked 't' for all payment types or 'CB' for cards only."  
  - Location p3===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Turning right on a red light is not allowed unless there is a flashing amber arrow.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "No, unless there's a flashing amber arrow. Always stop completely at red lights."  
  - Location p7===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Speeding fines range from €68 to €1,500 depending on severity, and rental companies may charge administrative fees in addition to fines.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Fines range from €68 to €1,500 depending on how much you exceeded the limit. Rental companies will charge your card and add an administrative fee."  
  - Location p6===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: The term 'rappel' on road signs indicates that a previous restriction, such as a speed limit, remains in effect after intersections or side roads.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "It means 'reminder' and indicates that a previous restriction (like a speed limit) is still in effect. You'll see it after intersections or side roads where drivers might forget the current rule."  
  - Location p8===from https://lecon.ai/blog/driving-in-france-road-rules-conversation-phrases

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: In France, vehicles drive on the right side of the road and have the steering wheel positioned on the left.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "In France, we drive on the right and the steering wheel is on the left."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: All passengers in a vehicle must wear seatbelts.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "It is compulsory to wear a seatbelt for all passengers."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Motorcyclists are required by law to wear helmets while riding.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "For motorcyclists, wearing a helmet is mandatory."  
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Drivers are prohibited from making phone calls unless using a hands-free device.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "It is also forbidden to make phone calls while driving unless you use a hands-free kit."  
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: The speed limits in France vary depending on the area 50 km/h in towns, 90 km/h (or 80 km/h in some areas) outside urban zones, and 130 km/h on highways—reduced to 110 km/h in rainy conditions.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "In France, the speed limit for light vehicles is  50 km/h in town, 90 km/h (80 in some places) outside the city, 130 km/h on the highway (110 km/h if it rains)"  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: France has various types of roads including freeways, which require toll payments for use.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "In France, one can drive on communal roads, departmental roads, national roads, roads with restricted access, European roads and on freeways. Freeways in France have tolls so that drivers can pay for their journey."  
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Honking at other drivers out of anger is strictly forbidden.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "56% honk at other drivers when they are angry, although honking for this reason is totally forbidden."  
  - Location paragraph 17===from https://www.ohlalafrenchcourse.com/en/blog/article/how-to-drive-in-france-car-and-driving-vocabulary

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Outdoor parking lots larger than 500 m² associated with certain economic and administrative buildings or open to the public must integrate stormwater management systems and shading devices over half of their area.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les parcs de stationnement concernés sont  les parcs de plus de 500 m², associés à certains bâtiments économiques et administratifs listés à l’article L. 171-4 du code de la construction et de l’habitation, ou des parcs de stationnement ouverts au public ;"
  - Location p8===from https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/politiques-publiques/parcs-stationnement

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: New outdoor parking lots, those undergoing major renovation, or subject to a new or renewed management contract or lease as of January 1, 2024, are required to include stormwater management and shading devices on at least half of the lot’s surface area.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "les parcs neufs, en rénovation lourde ou faisant l’objet de la conclusion ou d’un renouvellement de contrat ou de bail portant sur la gestion du parc à compter du 1er janvier 2024."
  - Location p8===from https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/politiques-publiques/parcs-stationnement

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Stormwater management devices on parking lots must promote soil permeability and allow for infiltration or evaporation of rainwater.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les dispositifs de gestion des eaux pluviales doivent favoriser la perméabilité des sols et l’infiltration (ou l’évaporation) des eaux."
  - Location p7===from https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/politiques-publiques/parcs-stationnement

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Shading devices on parking lots can consist of vegetated features such as trees or solar canopies that incorporate renewable energy production technology.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les dispositifs d’ombrage peuvent être des dispositifs végétalisés, comme des arbres, ou des ombrières comportant un procédé de production d’énergies renouvelables."
  - Location p7===from https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/politiques-publiques/parcs-stationnement

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Existing outdoor parking lots larger than 1,500 m² must be equipped with solar canopies incorporating renewable energy production on at least half of their surface area.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "l’article 40 de la loi relative à l’accélération de la production d’énergies renouvelables (dite « APER ») du 10 mars 2023 vise à mobiliser le gisement que représentent les parcs de stationnement extérieurs existants, en imposant à ceux d’une superficie de plus de 1 500 m² d’être équipés d’ombrières intégrant un procédé de production d’énergies renouvelables, sur au moins la moitié de leur superficie."
  - Location p9===from https://www.ecologie.gouv.fr/politiques-publiques/parcs-stationnement

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Outdoor parking lots larger than 1,500 m² must install photovoltaic solar canopies covering at least half of the surface area.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "La loi relative à l'accélération de la production d'énergies renouvelables (loi APER) du 10 mars 2023 précise la loi CliRé sur le dispositif d’ombrage, en imposant l’installation d’ombrières photovoltaïques sur au moins la moitié de la surface des parkings de plus de 1 500 m²."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: For all outdoor parking lots exceeding 500 m², two requirements apply (1) shading devices must cover at least half the area using either solar-panel-equipped canopies or vegetated structures, and (2) rainwater management systems must be installed on at least half the ground surface to promote permeability, infiltration, or evaporation.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "La loi Climat et résilience du 22 août 2021 (loi CliRé) impose deux types d’obligations différentes pour tous les parkings extérieurs de plus de 500 m² - dispositif d’ombrage sur au moins la moitié de la superficie du parking, soit par ombrières comportant des panneaux solaires (thermiques ou photovoltaïques), soit des dispositifs végétalisés (arbres ou pergolas végétalisées). - dispositifs de gestion des eaux pluviales sur au moins la moitié de la superficie au sol du parking par revêtements de surface, des aménagements hydrauliques ou des dispositifs végétalisés, favorisant la perméabilité des sols l’infiltration ou l’évaporation des eaux."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: For existing non-concessioned parking lots over 1,500 m², the installation deadline is July 1, 2028, for those between 1,500 and 10,000 m², and July 1, 2026, for those larger than 10,000 m². For concessioned or delegated public service parkings, installation must occur upon contract renewal, with deadlines aligned to the 2026 or 2028 thresholds depending on renewal timing.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "- parkings d’une surface comprise entre 1 500 et 10 000 m²  les ombrières doivent être installées au 1er juillet 2028 ; - parkings d’une surface supérieures à 10 000 m²  les ombrières doivent être installées au 1er juillet 2026 ;" and "Pour les parkings de plus de 1 500 m², les ombrières sont à installer lors du nouveau contrat de concession ou de délégation ou de son renouvellement."  
  - Location paragraph 7 (a° and b°)===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: The requirement to install photovoltaic canopies does not apply if equivalent renewable energy installations are present, if technical, safety, architectural, heritage, environmental, or landscape constraints prevent installation, if economically unfeasible, if natural shading from trees covers at least half the area, or if full or partial removal/renovation is planned and authorized before regulatory deadlines.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Cette obligation ne s'applique pas aux parkings extérieurs  - s’il y a installation d’EnR d’une production équivalente ; - si les ombrières ne peuvent pas être installées pour des contraintes bloquantes techniques, de sécurité, architecturales, patrimoniales et environnementales ou relatives aux sites et aux paysages ; - si les ombrières ne peuvent pas être installées dans des conditions économiquement acceptables ; - si les stationnements sont ombragés par des arbres sur au moins la moitié de leur superficie ; - si leur suppression ou transformation totale ou partielle est prévue dans une opération d'aménagement portée par une collectivité [...] et qu’une première autorisation est délivrée avant la date butoir correspondante"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Annual financial penalties are imposed for non-compliance until the parking meets regulations, up to €20,000 per year for parkings under 10,000 m² and up to €40,000 per year for larger ones, with the amount proportional to the severity of the violation.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "En cas de manquement, chaque année et jusqu'à la mise en conformité du parking, une sanction financière est prononcée à l'encontre du gestionnaire dans la limite d'un plafond  - de 20 000 euros si le parc est d'une superficie inférieure à 10 000 m² ; - de 40 000 euros si le parc est d'une superficie supérieure ou égale à 10 000 m². Cette sanction est proportionnée à la gravité du manquement."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Violations of the solar canopy regulation can be enforced by judicial police officers, commissioned and sworn state or public authority officials under the Urban Planning Code, and specific public officials designated under the Energy Code.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les éventuels manquements peuvent être constatés  - au titre du Code de l’urbanisme (art. L480-1)  par tous les officiers ou agents de police judiciaire ainsi que par tous les fonctionnaires et agents de l’État et des collectivités publiques commissionnés et assermentés à cet effet. - au titre du Code de l’énergie  par les fonctionnaires et les agents publics mentionnés à l'article du code (art. L. 142-21)."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.herault.gouv.fr/Actions-de-l-Etat/Transition-energetique/Obligations-d-ombrieres-photovoltaiques-sur-les-parkings

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Standard parking spaces in France must be at least 2.30 meters wide and 5 meters long to accommodate vehicles and allow sufficient clearance for maneuvers.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Conformément à l’article R111-14 du Code de la construction et de l’habitation (CCH), un espace doit mesurer au moins 2,30 mètres en largeur sur 5 mètres en longueur."
  - Location p6===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: At least 2% of parking spaces in public or private parking areas must be specifically designed and reserved for people with reduced mobility.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Selon le décret n°2006-1657 du 21 décembre 2006 relatif aux places réservées dans les aires de stationnement publiques ou privées, au moins 2% des espaces doivent être spécifiquement aménagés pour leur facilité d’accès."
  - Location p7===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Parking spaces designated for people with reduced mobility must have a minimum width of 3.30 meters and a minimum length of 5 meters.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Pour les personnes à mobilité réduite (PMR), ces mesures sont augmentées  une largeur minimale de 3,30 mètres et une longueur minimale identique sont requises."
  - Location p10===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Parking areas must have clear floor markings to identify parking spaces and an effective lighting system to ensure good visibility at all times.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Un marquage au sol clair doit faciliter l’identification des places. Chaque parking a besoin d’un système d’éclairage efficace pour permettre une bonne visibilité dans toutes les situations."
  - Location p10===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Parking barriers must have a minimum height of 1 meter to ensure ideal visibility and prevent potential dangers.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "La hauteur minimale de la barrière est déterminée à 1 mètre pour favoriser une visibilité idéale et prévenir tout danger potentiel."
  - Location p11===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Parking barriers must only be used to control access to parking areas and are prohibited from being used as blocking devices or to restrict access without prior consent.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Ils doivent être maniés avec soin et ne peuvent servir qu’à contrôler l’accès au stationnement. Il est prohibé de les employer comme outil de blocage ou pour limiter l’accès à certaines aires sans consentement préalable."
  - Location p12===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Parking installations, including barriers and other equipment, must be regularly maintained to ensure optimal performance, longevity, and user safety; any malfunction or deterioration must be promptly repaired.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Une maintenance régulière doit être effectuée pour garantir leur performance maximale et allonger leur espérance de vie. Tout dysfonctionnement ou détérioration doit faire l’objet d’une réparation rapide afin d’éviter tout danger éventuel pour les utilisateurs."
  - Location p13===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.feature: Failure to comply with French parking regulations may result in severe penalties, including financial fines or temporary or permanent closure of the parking facility.
Regulation_and_Policy-Transportation Rul.original:
- Quoted text "Les répercussions peuvent varier d’une pénalité financière à la fermeture temporaire ou permanente du parking."
  - Location p14===from https://www.stop-park.fr/normes-francaises-pour-parkings-publics-et-prives/

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.feature: Dates in French historical narratives are presented in strict chronological order, segmented by major historical periods, reflecting a linear and structured approach to time.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.original:
- Quoted text "L’école républicaine nous enseigne l’Histoire de France à travers ses grandes dates chronologiques."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.histourismo.fr/evenements-historiques/

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.feature: French historical date ordering follows a period-based structure, dividing history into Antiquity, Middle Ages, Modern Era, and Contemporary History, with dates listed sequentially within each period.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.original:
- Quoted text "Histourismo vous propose donc de retrouver ses grandes de l’Histoire de France à travers les grandes périodes de l’Antiquité (jusqu’en 476), du Moyen Age (476-1492), de l’Époque Moderne (1492-1789) et l’Histoire Contemporaine (1789 à nos jours)."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.histourismo.fr/evenements-historiques/

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.feature: In French culture, the standard date order is day/month/year, both in written and spoken formats, which differs from the American format of month/day/year.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.original:
- Quoted text "En même temps, les Français préfèrent indiquer jour/mois/année, ce qui se constate à l’écrit comme à l’oral."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://promova.com/fr/blog/date-formats-in-french

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.feature: In French, cardinal numbers (e.g., "trois") are used when writing dates, unlike in English where ordinal numbers (e.g., "third") are used; the exception is the first day of the month, which uses "premier".
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Date O.original:
- Quoted text "En anglais, les nombres ordinaux sont utilisés pour écrire une date, tandis qu’en français, c’est l’inverse. Par conséquent, les habitants du pays diront 'trois avril' [tʁwˈa ˈavril] au lieu de 'troisième avril' [troizjˈɛme ˈavril]. Le premier jour du mois fait exception à cette règle, car le mot 'premier' [pʁəmjˈe] sera utilisé."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://promova.com/fr/blog/date-formats-in-french

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: Cultural seasons in France are organized as time-bound events lasting between 3 to 6 months, indicating a structured and linear approach to cultural programming within the calendar year.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "A l’occasion des saisons culturelles, d’une durée de 3 à 6 mois, la France et le pays étranger invité sont appelés à faire découvrir les différentes facettes de leur culture à travers un ensemble de manifestations organisées sur leur territoire respectif."  
  - Location paragraph 5

- Rule Description The scheduling of cultural seasons follows specific start and end dates aligned with the Gregorian calendar, using precise months and years to define the duration of events.  
- ===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/europe-et-international/l-action-europeenne-et-internationale-du-ministere-de-la-culture/saisons-culturelles-croisees

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: The French Republican Calendar began each year on the autumnal equinox, specifically starting from September 22, 1792, which marked the proclamation of the French Republic.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "La numérotation des années commence à partir du 22 Septembre 1792 qui marque le début de la République (le jour où la Première République française est proclamée, un jour après la que Convention abolit la monarchie)."
  - Location paragraph 13

- Rule Description The calendar consisted of twelve months, each with exactly 30 days, divided into three ten-day weeks called "décades."
- ===from https://jeretiens.net/calendrier-republicain-ou-calendrier-revolutionnaire-francais/

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: The French cultural events organized by the Ministry of Culture are scheduled according to fixed dates in the Gregorian calendar, recurring annually or periodically on specific days and months.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "Les 10e Nuits de la lecture [...] se tiendront du 21 au 25 janvier 2026."
  - Location paragraph 8

- Rule Description Multiple national cultural events take place on consistent annual dates across years, indicating a structured reliance on the Gregorian calendar for planning and public communication.
- ===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/evenements-nationaux

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: France uses the Gregorian calendar system.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "Calendar type Gregorian calendar"
  - Location p1===from https://www.timeanddate.com/calendar/?country=5

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: In French calendars, public holidays and Sundays are typically marked in red, while typical non-working days are shown in gray.
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "Red – Public Holidays and Sundays. Gray – Typical Non-working Days."
  - Location p2===from https://www.timeanddate.com/calendar/?country=5

Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.feature: Some French public holidays occur on fixed dates each year, while others vary annually based on religious calendars or specific rules (e.g., occurring on a particular weekday in a given month).
Regulation_and_Policy-Date Format-Calend.original:
- Quoted text "Le Lundi de Pâques (un jour après Pâques) n’a pas de date fixe."  
  - Location p16  

  - Quoted text "Le Jeudi de l’Ascension (40 jours après Pâques) n’a pas de date fixe."  
  - Location p17  

  - Quoted text "Le Lundi de Pentecôte (50 jours après Pâques) n’a pas de date fixe."  
  - Location p18  

  - Quoted text "Célébrée chaque année fin mai ou début juin (date variable, en général le dernier dimanche de mai — sauf si cela tombe le même jour que la Pentecôte, auquel cas elle est reportée au premier dimanche de juin)"  
  - Location p22  

  - Quoted text "Le troisième dimanche de juin  la fête des pères"  
  - Location p25  

  - Quoted text "Le premier dimanche de mars  La fête des grands-mères"  
  - Location p20  

  - Quoted text "Le dernier vendredi du mois de mai  la fête des voisins"  
  - Location p24  

  - Quoted text "Chaque 21 juin, jour du solstice d’été"  
  - Location p26===from https://absolutelyfrench.com/la-culture-francaise-les-fetes-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French cultural approach to measurement emphasizes a standardized, unified system based on scientific principles rather than local or traditional units.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Alors que la révolution faisait rage dans les années 1790, les scientifiques français ont remplacé un système chaotique de poids et de mesures par une méthode unifiée  le système métrique."
  - Location p1===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: France abolished regionally variable and feudal-influenced systems of measurement in favor of a national standard to eliminate inconsistency and fraud.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Elle a également mis fin au droit de la noblesse de contrôler les poids et mesures utilisés dans leurs fiefs."
  - Location p4
- ===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French measurement system was designed to be grounded in universal natural constants and scientific reasoning rather than arbitrary human conventions.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Après quelques discussions, le groupe a adapté une idée proposée par Wilkins un siècle auparavant  un mètre équivaudrait à un dix-millionième de la distance du pôle Nord à l'équateur."
  - Location p8===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French system uses a decimal-based structure where units of length, mass, and volume are interrelated and scalable through powers of ten.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Les savants ont finalement convenu que les diverses unités de longueur, de masse et de volume du nouveau système seraient toutes liées les unes aux autres. Chacune pouvait être divisée et multipliée à l'aide d'une échelle décimale."
  - Location p6===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The state played a central role in defining and enforcing the new measurement system as part of its revolutionary reforms.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Le gouvernement républicain promit au peuple de France « une loi, un poids et une mesure », un objectif qui mit dix ans à être approuvé et plus encore à être accepté."
  - Location p5===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Despite official adoption, there was significant public resistance to using the metric system due to familiarity with old practices and distrust in pricing under the new system.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Beaucoup de gens préféraient garder leurs vieilles habitudes de mesure. En outre, en calculant les prix des marchandises sur la base du nouveau système, les vendeurs arrondissaient au chiffre supérieur, suscitant un peu plus la défiance du grand public pour ce nouveau système."
  - Location p10===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Long-term acceptance of the metric system in France was achieved not by law alone but through widespread education, literacy, and the teaching of science and commerce.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "En fin de compte, ce ne sont pas les lois qui installèrent durablement le système métrique en France, mais la généralisation de l'éducation, de l'alphabétisation et de l'apprentissage des sciences et du commerce."
  - Location p13===from https://www.nationalgeographic.fr/histoire/culture-generale-france-mathematiques-le-systeme-metrique-fruit-de-la-revolution-francaise

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French measurement system evolved from a fragmented and inconsistent set of local units into a unified, decimal-based metric system rooted in natural phenomena to ensure universality and precision.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Until the 18th century there was no unified measurement system. In spite of the attempts of Charlemagne and many kings after him, aiming to reduce the number of existing measurements, France was one of the most inventive and most chaotic countries in this area. In 1795 there were over seven hundred different 'unit of measurement' in France."
  - Location p2===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: French metrology emphasizes defining measurement units based on universal and unchanging natural phenomena rather than arbitrary or human-based references to ensure objectivity and global applicability.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Their intention was to produce an invariable measure by comparison with a standard borrowed from a natural phenomenon, the universal standard that Condorcet had dreamed of as far back as 1775, which would not be based on any national vanity and which could be used by all foreign nations."
  - Location p3===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The metre was originally defined as one ten-millionth of a quarter of the Earth's meridian, reflecting a commitment to scientific rationality and universality in measurement.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Introduced on 26 March 1791, the metre was defined as being equal to the ten millionth part of one quarter of the terrestrial meridian. The metre materialised the idea of a 'unit which in its determination was neither arbitrary nor related to any particular nation on the globe'."
  - Location p4===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French measurement system is fundamentally decimal, allowing simple conversion between multiples and sub-multiples by shifting the decimal point, which simplifies calculations in areas and volumes.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Decimalisation also brought a real revolution in the calculation of areas and volumes. Conversion from a multiple to a sub-multiple unit in area, and vice versa, simply consists of moving the decimal point two places, or three places for volume."
  - Location p6===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Over time, the French have supported the redefinition of SI units based on fixed fundamental physical constants rather than physical artifacts to improve long-term stability and global coherence.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "The basic principle of the revision of the SI is to base it not on the units themselves as it previously was, but on 7 constants of physics this is the paradigm shift of 2018."
  - Location p14===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: France plays a leading role in international metrology efforts, contributing to global standardization through institutions like the BIPM and collaborative research to define and refine measurement units.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "After 1860, adhesion increased particularly in the Latin American countries which joined the ranks of the many countries taking up the metric system. Nevertheless, these countries were dependent on France whenever exact copies of the metre and kilogram standards were required... the Bureau International des Poids et Mesures (B.I.P.M.) was founded in 1875..."
  - Location p8===from https://metrologie-francaise.lne.fr/en/metrology/history-units

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French Revolution introduced a unified measurement system as both a scientific advancement and a political act to standardize measurements across the national territory, replacing the previously fragmented local systems.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Sous la Révolution puis l’Empire, un nouveau système de mesures cohérent est instauré par l’État. Une innovation scientifique, mais aussi un acte politique destiné à unifier les échanges à travers l’ensemble du territoire national."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.histoire-et-civilisations.com/thematiques/epoque-contemporaine/1789-la-france-revolutionne-les-poids-et-mesures-74229.php

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Before the Revolution, France had an extremely diverse and inconsistent system of measurements, varying by province, canton, and even city, with hundreds of thousands of different values in use.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Elles diffèrent non seulement pour chaque province, mais chaque canton, et presque pour chaque ville... Car derrière les 800 dénominations existantes se cachaient pas moins de 250 000 valeurs différentes…"  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.histoire-et-civilisations.com/thematiques/epoque-contemporaine/1789-la-france-revolutionne-les-poids-et-mesures-74229.php

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Enlightenment scientists advocated for a unified system of weights and measures to facilitate commercial and scientific exchanges, recognizing the lack of uniformity as an obstacle to progress.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Forcés de constater qu’un tel manque d’uniformité favorisait l’arbitraire et entravait la communication et le commerce, les savants du siècle des Lumières ne tardèrent pas à préconiser des réformes consistant à unifier les systèmes de poids et de mesures pour faciliter les échanges commerciaux et scientifiques entre les pays."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.histoire-et-civilisations.com/thematiques/epoque-contemporaine/1789-la-france-revolutionne-les-poids-et-mesures-74229.php

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French Revolution provided the opportunity to abandon traditional measurement systems and establish a new standardized system based on rational and scientific principles.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "La Révolution française leur offrit l’occasion qu’ils attendaient pour rompre avec la tradition et reconstruire la société sur de nouvelles bases."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.histoire-et-civilisations.com/thematiques/epoque-contemporaine/1789-la-france-revolutionne-les-poids-et-mesures-74229.php

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: France adopted the metric system as its legal measurement system after the French Revolution due to the inconsistency and abuse present in the previous regional and trade-specific units.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "France has a unique history of units of measurement due to its radical decision to invent and adopt the metric system after the French Revolution."
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://handwiki.org/wiki/Physics:Units_of_measurement_in_France

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The metric system was reinstated as the sole legal system of measurement in France starting 1 May 1840, replacing the temporary use of traditional unit names under the mesures usuelles.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "La loi du 4 juillet 1837 (the law of 4 July 1837) of the July Monarchy effectively revoked the use of mesures usuelles by reaffirming the laws of measurement of 1795 and 1799 to be used from 1 May 1840."
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://handwiki.org/wiki/Physics:Units_of_measurement_in_France

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: Traditional French units such as the livre and stère were officially prohibited in favor of standardized International System of Units (SI), mandated by an EEC directive that required EU member states to use SI units like the watt.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "In 1977, these units, along with the stère and the livre (and amongst others, the German Pfund) were proscribed by EEC Directive 71/354/EEC which required EU member states to standardise on the International System of Units (SI) and therefore to use the watt and its multiples."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://handwiki.org/wiki/Physics:Units_of_measurement_in_France

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French measurement system transitioned from regionally and politically variable units (tied to the monarchy) to a universal, nature-based standard to ensure consistency and eliminate arbitrary control by rulers.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Les mesures de références étaient étalonnées selon les volontés du souverain. On mesurait alors en pied du Roi de France ou en pied du Rhin."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://unesco.delegfrance.org/L-instauration-du-systeme-metrique-decimal-1790-1837-Focus-Memoire-du-Monde-2639

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French adopted a measurement system based on natural constants rather than royal authority, choosing the length of one-quarter of the Earth's meridian as the foundation for the meter to ensure universality and objectivity.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "Suivant l’idée d’universalité, c’est la longueur du quart du méridien qui est retenue."  
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://unesco.delegfrance.org/L-instauration-du-systeme-metrique-decimal-1790-1837-Focus-Memoire-du-Monde-2639

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French government established permanent physical prototypes of the meter and kilogram made from durable platinum to serve as definitive reference standards, stored securely to ensure long-term stability and reproducibility.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "le mètre et le kilogramme en platine déposés le 4 Messidor dernier au Corps législatif par l’Institut national des Sciences et des Arts sont les étalons définitifs des mesures de longueur et de poids dans toute la République"  
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://unesco.delegfrance.org/L-instauration-du-systeme-metrique-decimal-1790-1837-Focus-Memoire-du-Monde-2639

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The use of the metric system was legally mandated across France starting January 1, 1840, following the law of July 4, 1837, which made the decimal metric system obligatory nationwide.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "c’est avec la loi du 4 juillet 1837, défendue par le ministre du Commerce, Martin, soutenue par Thiers et Guizot, que le système métrique décimal est rendu obligatoire partout en France à compter du 1er janvier 1840."  
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://unesco.delegfrance.org/L-instauration-du-systeme-metrique-decimal-1790-1837-Focus-Memoire-du-Monde-2639

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.feature: The French government implemented measures to propagate the new metric standards by installing public reference markers (e.g., 16 marble standards in Paris) and distributing certified copies to ensure uniformity and public access.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-M.original:
- Quoted text "16 étalons de marbre sont alors disposés dans Paris pour sensibiliser la population à cette nouvelle mesure, désormais obligatoire."  
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://unesco.delegfrance.org/L-instauration-du-systeme-metrique-decimal-1790-1837-Focus-Memoire-du-Monde-2639

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-L.feature: Immigration contributes to French culture by integrating into existing artistic traditions while maintaining dynamic connections between France and other cultures, thus enriching the national cultural identity through mobility and diverse influences.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-L.original:
- Quoted text "L’influence est multiple  elle consiste à s’inscrire dans une tradition artistique préexistante, à intégrer une identité inclusive et elle-même mouvante mais aussi à organiser des allers-retours entre l’ici et l’ailleurs, à multiplier les références, à décentrer les regards, à inscrire la France, physique mais aussi celle de la création, dans le monde..."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.histoire-immigration.fr/culture-et-diversite/quelles-empreintes-l-immigration-laisse-t-elle-dans-la-culture

Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-L.feature: Being fully French is compatible with being born elsewhere or having a name associated with foreign origins, as cultural belonging emphasizes contribution and inclusion rather than ethnic or geographic homogeneity.
Regulation_and_Policy-Measurement Unit-L.original:
- Quoted text "Ainsi peut-on être né ailleurs, porter un nom et même un prénom empreint d’exotisme et être pleinement français, et contribuer à perpétuer et à faire rayonner la culture française."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.histoire-immigration.fr/culture-et-diversite/quelles-empreintes-l-immigration-laisse-t-elle-dans-la-culture

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Cultural policy in France is jointly managed by national entities (such as the Ministry of Culture, DRACs, and public institutions like the CNAP) and local territorial authorities (regions, departments, intercommunalities, and communes), all of which have formal responsibilities and financial roles in supporting cultural creation and dissemination.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "En France, la politique culturelle est portée par le ministère de la Culture, les Directions régionales des affaires culturelles (DRAC) et ses établissements publics avec le Centre national des arts plastiques (CNAP) pour les arts visuels. Elle est aussi portée par les collectivités territoriales (régions, départements, intercommunalités, communes) qui ont une compétence générale d’intervention en matière culturelle et dont l’effort financier est important."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: The French Ministry of Culture has a legally defined mission to make major cultural works accessible to the widest possible audience, promote national cultural heritage, and support artistic and intellectual creation.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "la mission de rendre accessibles les œuvres capitales de l’humanité, et d’abord de la France, au plus grand nombre possible de Français, d’assurer la plus vaste audience à notre patrimoine culturel et de favoriser la création de l’art et de l’esprit qui l’enrichisse"  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: National and local institutions support a structured network of organizations involved in training, creation, and dissemination, including art schools, regional contemporary art funds, art centers, and public commissions.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "Ces institutions nationales et locales soutiennent un réseau d’établissements de formation et de soutien à la création et à la diffusion (écoles d’art, Fonds régionaux d’art contemporain, centres d’art, commandes publiques, etc.)"  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Public financial support for artists is regulated through standardized procedures such as individual project grants, emergency aid, residency programs, and architectural integration via the “1% artistique” program.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "les procédures d’aides individuelles au projet ou à l’artiste (1% artistique, soutien à un projet, secours exceptionnel, résidences, etc.)"  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: While the central administration of the Ministry of Culture sets strategic directions and allocates resources, the implementation of cultural policies is carried out regionally by DRACs and other decentralized bodies.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "L’administration centrale du ministère, sous l’autorité du ministre, définit les axes de politiques, élabore les procédures et répartit les moyens. Le soutien aux actions de création est ensuite porté par les DRAC et le CNAP."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Specific financial aid mechanisms such as individual creation grants (up to €8,000), installation allowances for studio development or equipment purchase, and the “1% artistique” are formally administered by DRACs to support artists.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "l’aide individuelle à la création [...] ne peut excéder 8 000 euros. l’allocation d’installation accordée aux artistes professionnels en activité pour leur permettre de financer  > un projet de travaux d’aménagement de leur lieu de travail (atelier) ; > un projet d’acquisition des équipements nécessaires à l’exercice de leur activité professionnelle. le 1% artistique qui permet aux artistes d’intervenir dans des projets architecturaux de bâtiments publics."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://federationdelarturbain.org/lorganisation-institutionnelle-de-la-culture-en-france/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: The French government actively supports the development of regulatory frameworks in other countries to strengthen local cultural sectors, particularly through promoting copyright laws and audiovisual regulation modeled on the French system.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "En matière de promotion du droit d’auteur, soutenir l’élaboration de cadres réglementaires appropriés agit comme un levier de développement pour la structuration des secteurs culturels."  
  - Location paragraph 18===from https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/politique-etrangere-de-la-france/diplomatie-culturelle/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: France promotes its national model of copyright protection internationally, which includes moral and economic rights for creators, as well as protections for performers and producers, positioning it as a reference in international and multilateral forums.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "Le droit d’auteur français protège les intérêts des créateurs en leur permettant de disposer de droits patrimoniaux et moraux sur leurs œuvres. Il assure également le respect des droits des artistes-interprètes et des producteurs, pour les œuvres cinématographiques, les bases de données, et les œuvres musicales."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/politique-etrangere-de-la-france/diplomatie-culturelle/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: France promotes a regulatory charter aimed at combating gender stereotypes and preventing sexual and sexist violence in cultural and creative industries, encouraging international adoption of this framework by public and professional entities.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "La Charte des industries culturelles et créatives figure parmi les initiatives portées par la France durant le Forum Génération Égalité. Elle comporte 10 engagements pour lutter contre les stéréotypes de genre."  
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/politique-etrangere-de-la-france/diplomatie-culturelle/

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: The French fashion market emphasizes a blend of industrial and artisanal production, supported by policies that secure the ecosystem of creativity, craftsmanship, subcontractors, and manufacturing expertise.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "La mode est une filière industrielle et artisanale. Elle se compose de plusieurs secteurs  bijouterie, chaussure, couture, cuirs et peaux, horlogerie, maroquinerie et textile, tous soutenus par divers dispositifs qui visent à accompagner et à sécuriser l’écosystème (créativité, savoir-faire, façonniers, sous-traitants)."  
  - Location paragraph 4

- Rule Description The French fashion market is deeply tied to heritage and creative prestige, with global recognition rooted in over three centuries of association with luxury and artisanal creation.  
- ===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/mode/la-mode-en-france

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Individuals are expected to behave in a professional and dignified manner, especially in formal or public situations.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "We expect our employees to conduct themselves in a professional manner at all times."
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://dictionary.cambridge.org/zhs/%E8%AF%8D%E5%85%B8/%E8%8B%B1%E8%AF%AD-%E6%B1%89%E8%AF%AD-%E7%AE%80%E4%BD%93/conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: How a person chooses to live their private life is considered their own personal matter.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "How you choose to conduct your private life is your own business!"
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://dictionary.cambridge.org/zhs/%E8%AF%8D%E5%85%B8/%E8%8B%B1%E8%AF%AD-%E6%B1%89%E8%AF%AD-%E7%AE%80%E4%BD%93/conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Maintaining composure and dignity in one’s behavior, particularly in formal roles or after public service, is valued.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "They were impressed by the dignified manner with which she conducted herself."
  - Location paragraph 10
  - Quoted text "Since leaving government, he has conducted himself with surprising grace and tact."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://dictionary.cambridge.org/zhs/%E8%AF%8D%E5%85%B8/%E8%8B%B1%E8%AF%AD-%E6%B1%89%E8%AF%AD-%E7%AE%80%E4%BD%93/conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Organizations may enforce strict rules governing behavior.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "The club has a strict code (= set of rules) of conduct."
  - Location paragraph 14===from https://dictionary.cambridge.org/zhs/%E8%AF%8D%E5%85%B8/%E8%8B%B1%E8%AF%AD-%E6%B1%89%E8%AF%AD-%E7%AE%80%E4%BD%93/conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Maintaining proper conduct involves adhering to legal statutes that are viewed as expressions of essential moral principles.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "Maintaining proper conduct, Europeans view legal statutes as manifestations of essential moral principles."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.iciba.com/word?w=conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: A person's conduct is subject to ethical evaluation, especially when it involves actions like accepting gifts from entities seeking governmental access.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "But it did so while holding its nose at the ethics of his conduct, which included accepting gifts such as a Rolex watch and a Ferrari automobile from a company seeking access to government."  
  - Location paragraph 25===from https://www.iciba.com/word?w=conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Institutions, such as courts, must follow a code of conduct to maintain public legitimacy and accountability.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "At the very least, the court should make itself subject to the code of conduct that applies to the rest of the federal judiciary."  
  - Location paragraph 26===from https://www.iciba.com/word?w=conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: An individual’s behavior during social events can negatively affect group dynamics and lead to personal criticism.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "His conduct casts a shadow over the gathering and is certain to draw additional personal criticism."  
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://www.iciba.com/word?w=conduct

Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.feature: Behavior in formal environments, such as meetings, is monitored and may result in accusations if deemed inappropriate.
Regulation_and_Policy-Financial Market R.original:
- Quoted text "She was accused of improper conduct during the meeting."  
  - Location paragraph 14===from https://www.iciba.com/word?w=conduct

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The region is the highest level of administrative division in France, subdivided into departments and communes.

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Each French region has powers and rights delegated by the central state, is overseen by a regional prefect, and managed by a regional council.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Chacune de ces régions dispose de pouvoirs et de droits délégués par l'État français, est administrée par un préfet de région, et gérée par un conseil régional."

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French regions are categorized based on three criteria legal personality, competences, and administrative autonomy.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Les régions françaises sont divisées selon 3 caractéristiques  la personnalité juridique, les compétences et la liberté d'administration."
  - Location paragraph 3 (under "Caractéristiques des régions françaises")===from https://www.regions-et-departements.fr/regions-francaises

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: France distinguishes between 13 metropolitan regions and 5 overseas regions, with the latter being single-department regions.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "La France compte 18 régions au total. Consultez ici la liste officielle des 13 régions de france métropolitaine et des 5 régions des territoires d'outremer français." and "Ces régions ultramarines ont la particularité d'être des régions monodépartementales"
  - Location paragraph 1 (under "Les Régions françaises 2025") and bullet point under "5 Régions & Départements d’Outremer"===from https://www.regions-et-departements.fr/regions-francaises

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Since January 1, 2016, the number of metropolitan regions was reduced from 22 to 13 through mergers, while the overseas regions remained unchanged.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:

Ce découpage administratif est en vigueur depuis la réforme territoriale du 1er janvier 2016." and "De 1970 à fin 2015, la France était composée d'un total de 27 régions car les régions métropolitaines étaient au nombre de 22. Les régions ultramarines sont, quant à elles, restées identiques avant et après 2016."
  - Location paragraph 1 and 2 (under "Les anciennes régions françaises (avant 2016)")===from https://www.regions-et-departements.fr/regions-francaises

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Each region has an official capital city known as the chef-lieu, which serves as the administrative center.

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The Basque people maintain a strong cultural identity, including a unique language (Euskara) and traditions, which they actively preserve despite lack of official recognition in France.

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The people of Pyrénées-Orientales identify strongly with their Catalan heritage, maintaining historical ties to Catalonia despite political integration into France.

- Rule Description The Catalan language remains in use in Pyrénées-Orientales, having survived periods when it was illegal, and is visible in public signage and cultural life.

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Brittany maintains a strong Celtic cultural identity, reflected in music, dance, and historical narratives tied to figures like King Arthur and Merlin.

- Rule Description Efforts to revive Breton cultural heritage began in the 1930s, leading to the formation of traditional dance groups and the popularization of Breton music featuring bagpipes.

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The French society is ethnically heterogeneous, composed of over 100 ethnic groups from all regions of the world, with ethnic French making up approximately 85% of the population.

  - Location paragraph 1 (p1)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: In France, the primary criterion for defining ethnicity is linguistic community, in contrast to other European countries where belonging to a collective is emphasized.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Tandis qu'en Allemagne, dans les pays slaves et dans l'Europe du Nord, les dérivés d'ethnos mettent l'accent sur le sentiment d'appartenance à une collectivité, en France le critère déterminant de l'ethnie est la communauté linguistique"
  - Location paragraph 2 (p2)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Only five indigenous minority groups are recognized as ethnically distinct from the French in specific regions of metropolitan France Alsacians, Basques, Bretons, Catalans, and Corsicans.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "seuls cinq groupes autochtones minoritaires sont référencés en tant que groupes ethniques distinctifs des Français et dans des régions définies."
  - Location paragraph 3 (p3)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Certain regional groups such as Gascons, Provençaux, Languedociens, Auvergnats, and Normands are considered integral parts of the French people from an ethnological perspective and are not classified as distinct ethnic groups.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:

  - Location paragraph 4 (p4)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Ethnicity is considered a taboo subject in Réunion due to historical policies of extreme assimilation.

  - Location paragraph 5 (p5)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French law prohibits the collection of personal data based on ethnicity, race, religion, or origin, resulting in no official national statistics on ethnic composition.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Selon des directives sur la collecte d'informations et d'après la loi informatique et libertés, la France s'interdit de collecter des informations personnelles fondées sur des caractères comme la race, l'ethnie, la couleur de peau, l'origine, la religion, le mode de vie ou le sexe, critères discriminatoires selon la loi."
  - Location paragraph 6 (p6)===from https://fr-academic.com/dic.nsf/frwiki/735746

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French is the official language of the French Republic, as established by the Constitution since 1992.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "À côté du français, langue nationale, dont le caractère officiel est inscrit depuis 1992 dans la Constitution..."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/en/thematiques/langue-francaise-et-langues-de-france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The use of French in everyday life is legally mandated in various contexts to ensure consumer and worker safety and rights, enforced through legislation such as the Toubon Law of 1994.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Ces dispositions contribuent notamment à garantir la santé et la sécurité des consommateurs et des salariés en imposant l’emploi du français dans un grand nombre de circonstances de la vie courante."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/en/thematiques/langue-francaise-et-langues-de-france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The French language is constitutionally established as the official language of the French Republic.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "le Parlement français a modifié la Constitution, dont l’article 2 définit désormais le français comme langue de la République."
  - Location p7===from https://www.cite-langue-francaise.fr/decouvrir/l-aventure-du-francais/a-la-decouverte-des-langues-regionales

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Regional languages are recognized as part of France's cultural heritage, though they do not hold official status.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "le Parlement a inséré dans la Constitution, en 2008, un article qui affirme que les langues régionales « appartiennent au patrimoine de la France »."
  - Location p7===from https://www.cite-langue-francaise.fr/decouvrir/l-aventure-du-francais/a-la-decouverte-des-langues-regionales

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French is the most widely spoken language in France, with 95.8% of the population reporting knowledge of it.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "french 95.8%"
  - Location p2===from https://languageknowledge.eu/countries/france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: English is the most commonly known foreign language in France, spoken by 24.6% of the population.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "english 24.6%"
  - Location p2===from https://languageknowledge.eu/countries/france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Spanish is the second most widely known foreign language in France, with 7.8% of the population reporting knowledge of it.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "spanish 7.8%"
  - Location p2===from https://languageknowledge.eu/countries/france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: German, Arabic, and Italian are also spoken in France, with 3.3%, 3.1%, and 2.5% of the population reporting knowledge of these languages respectively.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "german 3.3%", "arabic 3.1%", "italian 2.5%"
  - Location p2===from https://languageknowledge.eu/countries/france

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French is the official and dominant language of France, used in administration, education, and law, and is considered a cornerstone of national identity.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "French, or 'la langue française,' is not just the official language of France that is spoken by native speakers, but a cornerstone of its identity. Since the Ordinance of Villers-Cotterêts in 1539, the national language French has been the language of administration, education, and law."
  - Location p1 (under section "1. French The Language of Elegance and Unit")

- Rule Description Regional languages such as Breton, Occitan, Alsatian, Basque, and Corsican are part of France’s linguistic diversity and are associated with specific geographic regions and cultural identities.
- ===from https://civilisable.com/what-languages-are-spoken-in-france/

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: French is the only official language of France and is spoken by the vast majority of the population, with 97% of residents considered Francophone.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "French is the only official language in the constitution of the French Republic."
  - Location paragraph 8

- Rule Description Maghrebi Arabic is the second most widely spoken language in France, used by 3–4 million people, largely due to historical French influence in North Africa.
- ===from https://blog.rosettastone.com/languages-spoken-in-france/

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: The Seine River holds a prominent cultural status in France, particularly because it flows through Paris and is associated with iconic landmarks, contributing to the city's identity as a romantic and historic destination.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "What is the famous river in Paris called? – The River Seine bien sûr !"
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://frenchmoments.eu/rivers-in-france/

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: In French culture, there is a strong distinction between rivers that empty into the sea ("fleuve") and tributaries ("rivière"), and achieving "fleuve" status carries cultural, regional pride, and tourism significance.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "Gaining a fleuve status means a lot culturally and also touristically. It means ranking amongst the major rivers in France."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://frenchmoments.eu/rivers-in-france/

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Rivers in France are culturally revered due to their historical personification as deities, such as Sequana for the Seine, which has contributed to a lasting cultural respect for major rivers.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "For instance, Sequana was the goddess of the River Seine, to which its name derives."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://frenchmoments.eu/rivers-in-france/

Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.feature: Major rivers play a role in national identity, reinforced by geography education in French primary schools, which instills awareness of rivers as unifying national symbols.
Geography_and_Customs-Population_and_Geo.original:
- Quoted text "And the lessons in geography taught in French primary schools did the rest. They instilled a national binding role that the rivers play in our collective awareness."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://frenchmoments.eu/rivers-in-france/
