Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.feature: The integration of traditional medicine into national health systems must be appropriate, safe, and evidence-based, with scientific validation through rigorous clinical trials to ensure efficacy and safety, even for treatments with long-standing traditional use.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.original:
- Quoted text "L’intégration de la MTCI dans les systèmes de santé nationaux doit se faire de manière appropriée, efficace et sûre, sur la base des éléments de preuve scientifiques les plus récents. [...] Il est crucial d’adopter une démarche fondée sur des données probantes ; même si les médicaments traditionnels sont issus d’une pratique de longue date, il est essentiel d’établir leur efficacité et leur innocuité moyennant des essais cliniques rigoureux."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.who.int/fr/news-room/questions-and-answers/item/traditional-medicine

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.feature: Traditional medicine has significantly contributed to modern medicine, with approximately 40% of pharmaceutical products derived from natural sources rooted in traditional practices, including major drugs such as aspirin, cancer treatments, and antimalarial medication.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.original:
- Quoted text "Aujourd’hui, environ 40 % des produits pharmaceutiques ont une base de produits naturels, et des médicaments phares proviennent de la médecine traditionnelle. La médecine traditionnelle a contribué à des découvertes médicales révolutionnaires et il existe une longue histoire de phytothérapie traduite en traitements efficaces contre certaines pathologies."  
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://www.who.int/fr/news-room/questions-and-answers/item/traditional-medicine

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.feature: Modern technologies such as artificial intelligence are being applied to advance the study of traditional medicine, enabling researchers to analyze vast bodies of traditional knowledge, map evidence, and identify previously undetectable patterns.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Diet and Hea.original:
- Quoted text "L’intelligence artificielle (IA) apparaît comme pouvant changer la donne, révolutionnant l’étude et la pratique des systèmes de guérison traditionnels. Les algorithmes avancés et les capacités d’apprentissage automatique de l’IA peuvent permettre aux chercheuses et chercheurs d’explorer de vastes connaissances médicales traditionnelles, de cartographier les données probantes et d’identifier des tendances autrefois insaisissables."  
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://www.who.int/fr/news-room/questions-and-answers/item/traditional-medicine

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices should integrate culture and arts into formal, non-formal, and informal learning environments to ensure inclusivity, cultural relevance, and lifelong learning.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "L’UNESCO publie un nouveau guide qui traduit le Cadre de l’UNESCO pour l’éducation artistique et culturelle — adopté lors de la Conférence mondiale de l’UNESCO sur l’éducation à la culture et aux arts d'Abou Dhabi, aux Émirats arabes unis, en février 2024 — en politiques et pratiques concrètes."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Learning environments must reflect the cultural identities, needs, and contexts of learners to ensure educational relevance and inclusiveness.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Garantir que les environnements d’apprentissage reflètent les identités, besoins et contextes culturels des apprenants"  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices should promote inclusion and respect for cultural diversity through curriculum design and learning environments.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Éducateurs et professionnels de la culture qui conçoivent les curricula et programmes, ainsi que des environnements d’apprentissage favorisant l’inclusion et le respect de la diversité culturelle"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational content and activities should be co-created with youth and civil society actors to ensure community relevance, innovation, and engagement.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Jeunes et acteurs de la société civile qui co-créent des contenus et activités tout en garantissant leur pertinence, l’innovation et l’engagement des communautés"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educators and cultural professionals should collaborate closely to develop interdisciplinary programs and holistic learning systems.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Permettre aux décideurs, aux éducateurs et aux acteurs culturels de collaborer étroitement et de co-créer des programmes intersectoriels, façonnant ainsi des systèmes d’apprentissage holistiques."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices should incorporate community-based cultural expressions such as art festivals, music, heritage sites, and local media to support cultural learning.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Sont également présentées des pratiques ancrées dans les communautés par le biais de festivals d’art et de musique en Azerbaïdjan, en Iran et au Maroc, par la valorisation du patrimoine matériel comme le Musée de l’Apartheid en Afrique du Sud, ou encore une émission de radio au Pakistan offrant un apprentissage culturel à des groupes marginalisés."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Policymakers should develop long-term strategies and strengthen coordination to integrate culture and arts within education systems.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Le guide présente aux décideurs des recommandations pour élaborer des stratégies sur le long terme, renforcer la coordination et intégrer la culture et les arts au sein des systèmes éducatifs."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.unesco.org/fr/articles/un-guide-pratique-pour-transformer-leducation-par-la-culture-et-les-arts

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices in France emphasize access to artistic and cultural activities as a means of transmitting knowledge and fostering personal and collective identity, contributing to citizenship education.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "La transmission des savoirs par l’accès à la pratique artistique et culturelle"
  - Location p10===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices involve creating a continuous educational experience from preschool through university by bridging school, after-school, and extracurricular time, particularly for children, youth, and their families.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Les fédérations d’Éducation populaire s’engagent, en cohérence avec les différentes offres d'éducation artistique et culturelle existantes, à prendre en compte les différents temps de l'enfant, du jeune et de leurs familles  temps scolaire, périscolaire et extrascolaire et assurer leur rôle de passerelle entre ces différents temps de la vie. Elles participent activement à mettre en place un continuum tout au long de la scolarité, de la maternelle à l'université."
  - Location p12===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices aim to reduce inequalities by improving mastery of the French language, which is seen as essential for social, cultural, and professional development.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Les fédérations s’efforcent de réduire les inégalités face à la maîtrise de la langue qui contribuent à creuser davantage les écarts dans les trajectoires individuelles, aux plans social, culturel et professionnel."
  - Location p15===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices incorporate digital technology as a tool for cultural exploration and creative expression, with efforts focused on ensuring broad access to digital practices and addressing socioeconomic and cultural aspects of the digital divide.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Le numérique comme levier de découverte et de création culturelles"
  - Location p16===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices include media and information education to develop individual and collective responsibility and critical thinking, especially among youth during extracurricular time.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "L’éducation aux médias doit développer le sens critique et celui des responsabilités personnelles et collectives."
  - Location p17===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Educational practices promote civic learning through volunteerism and civic service, supporting volunteers and civic service participants in activities that advance cultural access and republican values.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "L’engagement est un préalable à toute démarche d’Éducation populaire. Les fédérations d’Éducation populaire le promeuvent et accompagnent, dans ce cadre, les bénévoles volontaires de l’encadrement et de l’animation, et les volontaires du service civique. Ils permettent à ces derniers de conforter leur apprentissage de la citoyenneté, en participant à des actions qui favorisent l’accès de tous à la culture et mettent celle-ci au service des valeurs républicaines."
  - Location p21===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/developpement-culturel/le-developpement-culturel-en-france/culture-et-education-populaire

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: The Agence pour l’enseignement français à l’étranger (AEFE) implements an innovative pedagogical policy that combines adherence to French national curricula with openness to the host country's language and culture.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Elle met en œuvre une politique pédagogique innovante qui concilie respect des programmes scolaires en vigueur en France et ouverture à la langue et à la culture du pays d’accueil."  
  - Location paragraph 2 (under "Agence pour l’enseignement français à l’étranger (AEFE)" section, subsection "Pilotage")

- Rule Description The AEFE recruits, pays, and inspects teaching staff from the French National Education system and assigns them to schools under its direct management or associated through agreements.  
- ===from https://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/le-ministere-et-son-reseau/les-operateurs-sous-la-tutelle-du-ministere/article/culture-education-francophonie

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Teachers are expected to act as cultural mediators, assuming responsibility for their role in transmitting and fostering Francophone culture by guiding students in their identity development.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Conscients de leur rôle de passeur, d’intermédiaire, d’éveilleur, d’accompagnateur, de médiateur culturel et de modèle culturel, les intervenants en assument les responsabilités."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.pelf.ca/Initiative/ApprocheCulturelle

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Teachers support students’ sense of belonging to the French language and its associated cultures by establishing healthy interpersonal relationships.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Le personnel enseignant qui prend soin d’établir des relations interpersonnelles saines avec les élèves favorise leur sentiment d’affiliation à la langue française et aux cultures qui la sous-tendent."  
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://www.pelf.ca/Initiative/ApprocheCulturelle

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Teachers' support plays a more significant role in contributing to the global school satisfaction of students in a bilingual family language context, even though these students report feeling less supported by their teachers compared to monolingual peers.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "children who live in a bilingual family language context feel less supported by their teacher even though this support contributes more significantly to their global school satisfaction."
  - Location paragraph 1 (Abstract)===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12187-024-10128-3

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Teachers in France often lack adequate training and awareness regarding students’ linguistic diversity, leading to feelings of unpreparedness and sometimes advising parents against using minority languages at home.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "The training of primary school teachers is based on the implicit principle that all students are francophone and monolingual... Teachers appear to be insufficiently trained to handle the question of languages at school; a lot of them feel powerless and apprehensive of teaching in classrooms with bilingual students."
  - Location paragraph 14 (1.2.1 Satisfaction with Teacher-Student Relationship)===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12187-024-10128-3

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Teachers have a key role in facilitating integration, learning, and well-being for students who speak a language other than the language of instruction, and their supportive practices can improve student resilience and mental health.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "teachers play a key role by facilitating the integration, learning, development and success of students who speak another language than the language of instruction... and more generally speaking, in predicting their mental health."
  - Location paragraph 13 (1.2.1 Satisfaction with Teacher-Student Relationship)===from https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s12187-024-10128-3

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Specializing in Cultural Policy and Management enables graduates to pursue careers in culture-related fields across public, private, and non-profit sectors.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Specialising in Cultural Policy and Management allows you to work in a wide range of professional environments, in the public, private or non-profit sectors Ministry of Culture, Ministry of European and Foreign Affairs, local authorities, Alliances Françaises, French institutes, cultural institutions, museums, theatres, national arts institutes, arts and culture companies, non-profit organisations, NGOs, arts foundations, corporate foundations, consultancies, etc."
  - Location p11===from https://www.sciencespo.fr/ecole-affaires-publiques/en/careers/actions-opportunities/career-opportunities-arts-culture-sector/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Completion of the Cultural Policy and Management policy stream provides access to specific career paths such as cultural policy reform, management of cultural institutions, cultural industries, art market, performing arts, heritage, cultural cooperation, diplomacy, and project management.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "On completion of the Cultural Policy and Management policy stream, the knowledge and skills acquired open up career opportunities in various fields Cultural policy management and reform, at the local, national or European level; Management of cultural institutions; Cultural industries (cinema, audiovisual sector, music, publishing, media); The art market; Performing arts (cultural institutions or events); Cultural heritage, museums; Cultural cooperation; Cultural diplomacy; Cultural project management."
  - Location p9===from https://www.sciencespo.fr/ecole-affaires-publiques/en/careers/actions-opportunities/career-opportunities-arts-culture-sector/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Graduates with a master’s in Cultural Policy and Management can pursue diverse professions including director, administrator, producer, programming officer, communications officer, marketing officer, sponsorship officer, project manager, cooperation officer, and consultant within the cultural sector.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "It opens the door to a variety of professions to pursue a career in culture-related fields Director of a cultural institution; Art director in publishing; Administrator of a cultural institution; Festival or company administrator; Producer; Programming officer; Communications officer; Marketing officer; Sponsorship officer; Cultural or audiovisual project manager; Public Relations officer; Brand manager; Project manager, production manager; Cooperation officer; Consultant."
  - Location p12===from https://www.sciencespo.fr/ecole-affaires-publiques/en/careers/actions-opportunities/career-opportunities-arts-culture-sector/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Proficiency in oral expression is considered essential for entering cultural careers, particularly those involving public interaction, as it fosters confidence, clarity, and social integration.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "La maîtrise de l'expression orale est un atout essentiel pour l'insertion professionnelle, notamment dans les métiers de la culture qui impliquent un contact direct avec le public."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/actualites/l-eloquence-pour-inserer-les-jeunes-dans-les-metiers-de-la-culture

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Career access initiatives in the cultural sector specifically target young people aged 16 to 25 who lack formal qualifications, employment, or ongoing training, aiming to provide them with alternative pathways into cultural professions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Le programme cible cent jeunes de 16 à 25 ans, sans diplôme ni qualification, qui sont sans emploi, ni formation."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/actualites/l-eloquence-pour-inserer-les-jeunes-dans-les-metiers-de-la-culture

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Direct exposure to cultural institutions through partnerships (e.g., Louvre, BnF, Académie française) allows young participants to discover cultural careers and potentially develop aspirations to pursue them professionally.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Bien plus d'un programme de formation, il s’agit de rencontres avec des professionnels de la culture et d’immersions dans des établissements culturels. Nous offrons à ces jeunes l'opportunité de découvrir les métiers de la culture et ce programme donnera aussi, je l'espère, l'envie d'en faire leur métier"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/actualites/l-eloquence-pour-inserer-les-jeunes-dans-les-metiers-de-la-culture

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Gaining confidence in public speaking is viewed as a means of personal emancipation, improved social cohesion, and enhanced professional opportunities, especially within the cultural sector.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "C'est aussi une façon de s'émanciper et de renforcer notre cohésion sociale ; cette émancipation et cette cohésion sociale sont ma priorité. Ce sont aussi le cœur de ce projet."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/actualites/l-eloquence-pour-inserer-les-jeunes-dans-les-metiers-de-la-culture

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.feature: Training programs preparing youth for cultural careers emphasize both verbal and non-verbal communication skills, including speech construction, managing anxiety, and delivering impactful messages.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Education an.original:
- Quoted text "Elle combine d’une part un travail sur la prise de parole et la communication (développement des compétences en communication verbale et non verbale, gestion son trac, construction d’un discours clair et impactant)"  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/actualites/l-eloquence-pour-inserer-les-jeunes-dans-les-metiers-de-la-culture

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Fireworks are a central festive entertainment activity on Bastille Day, celebrated nationwide to commemorate the historical event and foster national unity.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "The fireworks are the highlight of the night, illuminating the sky with magnificent colors and shapes."  
  - Location p4===from https://www.startfrenchnow.com/fr/blog/post/les-fetes-traditionnelles-francaises-celebrations-et-coutumes-uniques?postLang=en

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: On June 21st, musical performances take place in public spaces across France as part of a unified national celebration of music, originating from a centralized cultural initiative.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Outdoor concerts are organized in the streets and squares, showcasing the musical diversity of the country."  
  - Location p10===from https://www.startfrenchnow.com/fr/blog/post/les-fetes-traditionnelles-francaises-celebrations-et-coutumes-uniques?postLang=en

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The tradition of making and flipping crêpes on February 2nd is a festive culinary activity practiced throughout France, rooted in shared religious origins and bringing families together.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "The French love to prepare and savor sweet or savory pancakes on this day."  
  - Location p7===from https://www.startfrenchnow.com/fr/blog/post/les-fetes-traditionnelles-francaises-celebrations-et-coutumes-uniques?postLang=en

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Maraichine is traditionally danced in small circles or lines, with men and women alternating positions, performing a sequence of backward steps, polka steps, jumps, and forward movements.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Hommes et femmes sont disposés de façon alternée, reculent, effectuent un pas de polka, sautent, puis repartent en avant."
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Laridé is a circle dance performed with men and women alternating and holding hands by the little finger, moving to the left while synchronizing foot movements with swinging arm motions directed downward.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Hommes et femmes sont alternés, se tiennent par le petit doigt et se déplacent vers la gauche. Pendant que les pieds se déplacent vers la gauche, les bras, dirigés vers le bas, basculent d’avant en arrière."
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Gavotte is typically danced in a circle or chain formation, with dancers linked by their little fingers, stepping forward and backward four times with the right foot before resuming walking motion, all while moving to the left.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Se tenant par le petit doigt, les danseurs se déplacent vers la gauche  pied droit en avant, pied droit en arrière, et ce à quatre reprises, avant de repartir en marchant."
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Passe-pied is a fast and dynamic traditional Breton dance performed in triple time using gliding steps, derived from the Branle tradition.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Il s’agit là encore d’une forme de Branle, dynamique et rapide, qui se danse sur un air à trois temps, en pas glissés."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Farandole is an open-chain folk dance where participants hold hands and jump on each beat, led by a dancer who guides the line into serpentine shapes, symbolizing communal joy.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Main dans la main, les danseurs marquent chaque temps par un petit saut. Un meneur guide la chaîne en se déplaçant de sorte à ce que celle-ci soit semblable à un serpent."
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Rigodon is a flirtatious couple dance originating from Dauphiné, performed by two, four, or multiple pairs who execute stationary jumps, once considered indecent but later accepted at Versailles and in operas.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Le Rigodon est une danse de séduction qui est d’abord jugé indécente, mais toutefois dansée à la cour de Versailles et dans les opéras. Le Rigodon se danse à deux, à quatre ou à plusieurs paires de danseurs effectuant des sauts sur place."
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The dance associated with the Carnaval de Lantz is a binary, fast-tempo folk dance performed individually or in circles, involving spinning movements on oneself.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Elle se danse en cercles et individuellement, en tournoyant sur soi-même."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Fandango is a couple dance of Spanish origin introduced in Labourd around 1870, consisting of a ternary-rhythm waltz followed by a faster binary-rhythm dance accompanied by castanets.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Il s’agit d’une valse au rythme ternaire, suivi d’une seconde danse au rythme binaire, mais plus rapide, dansée en couple au son des castagnettes."
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Java is a sensual ballroom dance from 1920s Paris, danced closely with small steps and hip movements, distinguishing it from classical waltzes.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Il s’agit d’une valse rapide, plus sensuelle que la valse classique puisqu’elle se danse de manière très rapprochée, à petit pas, avec des mouvements de bassins."
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Cancan originated as an improvised, energetic male-only dance called Chahut in 1820s–30s Parisian balls, featuring jumps, shouts, and wild movements; later adopted by women despite initial prohibitions, evolving into a choreographed performance known today as French Cancan involving raised knees, forward kicks, and specific posture.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Il s’agit à l’époque d’une danse d’improvisation – surnommée Chahut – que les hommes exécutent seuls, pendant le quadrille, et au cours de laquelle sautillements, hurlements et mouvements déchaînés s’entremêlent... Aujourd’hui, le Cancan, dit French Cancan, se danse avec les mains sur les hanches, les épaules en arrière  un genou levé, un petit saut sur place, puis le genou abaissé, et le pied lancé en avant."
  - Location paragraph 14===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The Bourrée is a traditional dance from central France, commonly associated with Auvergne, performed with lines of men and women facing each other, approaching and retreating in two-step sequences, then crossing over to join their partner’s line twice.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "S’il existe plusieurs manières de danser la Bourrée, la pratique la plus courante consiste à mettre face à face une ligne de femmes et une ligne d’hommes. Chaque couple se rapproche en deux pas de bourrée, puis fait marche arrière. Et ce, quatre fois. Après quoi les deux partenaires se croisent, face à face, pour rejoindre la ligne de leur partenaire. Et ce, deux fois de suite."
  - Location paragraph 15===from https://www.geo.fr/histoire/danses-folkloriques-top-des-danses-traditionnelles-francaises-208888

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Traditional Breton dances such as the "gavotte" and "andro" are closely tied to communal music and are performed in circles or chains, reinforcing social bonds within communities.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les danses bretonnes, comme l’ando ou la gavotte, sont indissociables de cette musique. Elles se pratiquent en rond ou en chaîne, renforçant le lien social au sein des communautés."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://musicexplorer.fr/histoire-et-evolution-des-musiques-regionales-bretonne-occitane-corse-etc/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Traditional dances in Occitania, such as the "farandole" and "bourrée," are part of the region's popular music repertoire and contribute to its cultural expression.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Au-delà du chant lyrique des troubadours, l’Occitanie a développé un large répertoire de musiques populaires avec des danses comme la farandole ou la bourrée."  
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://musicexplorer.fr/histoire-et-evolution-des-musiques-regionales-bretonne-occitane-corse-etc/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Events such as "fest-noz" and regional festivals play a key role in maintaining and transmitting traditional music and dance practices in Brittany and other regions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Aujourd’hui, elle est toujours très présente à travers les fest-noz et les festivals dédiés."  
  - Location paragraph 11  
  - Quoted text "Les festivals, comme le Festival Interceltique de Lorient ou les fest-noz bretons, jouent un rôle clé dans leur diffusion."  
  - Location paragraph 18===from https://musicexplorer.fr/histoire-et-evolution-des-musiques-regionales-bretonne-occitane-corse-etc/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: France played a foundational role in the development of ballet by creating the first unified ballet performance that combined music, dance, plot, and design into a cohesive dramatic form.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Because it fused the elements of music, dance, plot, and design into a dramatic whole, it is considered the first ballet."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The French monarchy formally institutionalized ballet by establishing the Académie Royale de Danse, which became a dominant force in European theatrical dance.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "In 1661 Louis XIV established the Académie Royale de Danse (now the Paris Opéra Ballet); the company dominated European theatrical dance of the 18th and early 19th centuries."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Fundamental aspects of ballet technique, including the five basic positions, were codified by French choreographers, standardizing practice and training.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Pierre Beauchamp, the company’s first director, codified the five basic ballet positions."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: A major cultural reform in French ballet emphasized dramatic motivation and storytelling over technical display, leading to the concept of ballet d’action.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Jean-Georges Noverre brought about major reforms in ballet production, stressing the importance of dramatic motivation, which he called ballet d’action, and decrying overemphasis on technical virtuosity."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The French ballet tradition initiated the Romantic ballet era with the premiere of La Sylphide, marking a shift toward ethereal themes and new stylistic expressions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "In 1832 the Paris Opéra Ballet initiated the era of Romantic ballet by presenting Italian Filippo Taglioni’s La Sylphide."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: In the 20th century, France contributed to the rejuvenation of ballet through the founding of the avant-garde Ballets Russes in Paris, which became the leading Western ballet company for two decades.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "In the 20th century ballet was rejuvenated under the leadership of Russian impresario Sergey Diaghilev, who founded the avant-garde Ballets Russes in Paris in 1909. For the next two decades it was the leading ballet company in the West."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: France developed and popularized lighter dance forms such as the cancan, which became a prominent feature of music halls, revues, and operetta in 19th-century Paris.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "In 19th-century Paris the all-female cancan became the rage. After 1844 it became a feature of music halls, revues, and operetta."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.britannica.com/place/France/Dance

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The French government supports traditional music and dance through dedicated institutions, including the Centre d'information des musiques et danses traditionnelles (CIMT), which focuses specifically on traditional music and dance.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Centre d'information des musiques et danses traditionnelles (CIMT)"
  - Location paragraph 18

(Note Only one cultural characteristic is extracted as it is the only one explicitly related to traditional music and dance in the provided text.)===from https://www.culture.gouv.fr/thematiques/danse/la-danse-en-france

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Contemporary French art emphasizes innovation that is accessible to everyone, not limited to elite or specialized audiences.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "innovation rime avec accessibilité, et chaque vernissage est une invitation à questionner le monde ou, mieux encore, à s'en amuser."
  - Location p1===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The French contemporary art scene continues the tradition of defying artistic norms, supported by institutions and proactive cultural policies.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "La tradition française de défi aux normes artistiques perdure au XXIe siècle grâce à des institutions comme le Centre Pompidou ou des prix tels que le Marcel Duchamp qui catapultent nos créateurs sur la scène mondiale."
  - Location p3===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: There is no adherence to a single artistic doctrine; artists freely mix styles and mediums without being confined by academic boundaries.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "L’absence totale de dogmatisme  chacun pioche où bon lui semble — quitte à saboter joyeusement toutes les frontières académiques."
  - Location p7===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Artists frequently combine different disciplines such as painting, sculpture, digital media, and performance, creating hybrid forms of expression.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "L’hybridation disciplinaire n’est plus une tendance  c’est un terrain de jeu insatiable pour ceux qui refusent toute hiérarchie des médiums."
  - Location p12===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Sculptors and artists use a wide range of materials, including recycled and "impure" materials, rejecting the traditional hierarchy of noble versus common materials.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "L’irruption de matériaux 'impurs' (plastique recyclé, coquillages voire os), assumée par une génération qui refuse le diktat du noble — on n’est plus chez Rodin !"
  - Location p9===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Major figures in French contemporary art are defined by their ability to transgress codes and avoid superficiality, setting an example for future generations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Aucun de ces artistes ne s’est laissé enfermer dans un style ou un médium unique  leur héritage réside dans cette capacité à transgresser les codes sans jamais sombrer dans le clinquant ou le cynisme creux."
  - Location p6===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Female artists in particular address current societal issues such as gender representation, social justice, ecology, and personal experience with a critical and often subversive perspective.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Elles articulent vécu intime et interrogation politique sans filtre ni cliché militantiste, secouant sérieusement le cocotier — pour notre plus grand plaisir visuel et intellectuel."
  - Location p11===from https://www.arlesaparis.fr/culture-inspirations/artistes-contemporains-francais-figures-majeures-tendances-nouveaux-talents

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Contemporary French art often explores complex themes such as gender, identity, and societal issues through diverse media including video, installation, performance, and conceptual art.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "In the new millennium artists in France created works that explored many topics in a single work of art, such as gender, identity, uncommon materials, text, performance, conceptualism, and so on."
  - Location p1 (paragraph immediately before "French Art in the Global Context")===from https://artincontext.org/french-art/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Contemporary French artists incorporate unconventional materials and modern sculptural forms, expanding beyond traditional techniques to include large-scale installations and intellectual expressions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "The traditional motif of the sculptural figure has also been modernized in contemporary advancements in French art."
  - Location p2===from https://artincontext.org/french-art/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: A rebellious spirit characterizes contemporary French art, with artists using street art and public interventions to make political and social critiques.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Additionally, there is a rebellious spirit of artmaking among French artists today, echoing the early modernists’ risk-taking. Graffiti artists like Blek le Rat, Jef Aérosol, and JR have pushed their Street Art into the broader contemporary art scene, often employing their works of art to make significant political and social comments about the world around them."
  - Location p3===from https://artincontext.org/french-art/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Major institutions and venues in France, such as the Fondation Louis Vuitton and the Bourse de Commerce, play a significant role in showcasing prominent contemporary art exhibitions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les grands noms comme David Hockney, Eva Jospin ou Jeff Koons, les plus grandes foires comme Art Basel ou Art Paris, sans oublier les spectaculaires expositions de la Fondation Louis Vuitton ou encore de la Bourse du Commerce  « Connaissance des Arts » sélectionne pour vous les meilleurs événements de l’art contemporain !"
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: French cultural platforms recognize and celebrate international contemporary artists through major exhibitions and awards, highlighting their global influence within the French art scene.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Art contemporain  l’artiste Nnena Kalu remporte le Prix Turner 2025, une première historique"
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Large-scale art fairs such as Art Basel and Art Paris are considered central events in the French contemporary art calendar, drawing widespread attention and participation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les grands noms comme David Hockney, Eva Jospin ou Jeff Koons, les plus grandes foires comme Art Basel ou Art Paris, sans oublier les spectaculaires expositions de la Fondation Louis Vuitton ou encore de la Bourse du Commerce..."
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: There is a cultural emphasis on making contemporary art accessible to the public through free exhibitions in galleries and museums across Paris and other cities.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Paris  37 expositions (gratuites) en galeries d’art ouvrent le bal de la folle semaine de l’art contemporain"
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Contemporary art in France is often presented in dialogue with historical art forms, such as medieval or romantic painting, emphasizing continuity and contrast between artistic periods.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Exposition à Paris  au musée Delacroix, l’art contemporain réveille l’âme de la peinture romantique"
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: French cultural institutions support both emerging and established artists through prestigious prizes like the Prix Marcel Duchamp and dedicated retrospectives at major foundations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "L’artiste Xie Lei remporte le Prix Marcel Duchamp 2025 à Paris"
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.connaissancedesarts.com/art-contemporain/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The contemporary art scene in France is characterized by a blend of diversity, innovation, tradition, and modernity, fostering a creative dialogue that addresses themes such as identity, society, and the environment.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "La scène artistique française contemporaine se distingue par sa diversité et son innovation, mêlant tradition et modernité dans un dialogue créatif fascinant."
  - Location p1===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Collaboration between artists, collectives, and institutions is fundamental to the evolution of French contemporary art, with interdisciplinary approaches encouraging exchanges between art, science, and technology.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "La collaboration entre artistes, collectifs et institutions joue un rôle fundamental dans l’évolution de cette scène. De nombreux projets sont impulsés par des approches interdisciplinaires, favorisant les échanges entre art et sciences, art et technologie."
  - Location p3===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: French contemporary artists employ innovative media such as immersive installations and interactive technologies to expand artistic expression and audience engagement.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Pierre Huyghe se distingue par ses installations immersives et ses explorations de la nature, de la mémoire et du temps, où il fusionne art, science et environnement..."
  - Location p4===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Contemporary French artists use their work to address pressing social and political issues such as climate change, human rights, and inequality, transforming public spaces into sites of reflection and dialogue.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les artistes contemporains utilisent leur créativité pour aborder ces thèmes, transformant des espaces publics en lieux de réflexion et de dialogue, et incitant le spectateur à questionner son propre rôle dans la société."
  - Location p7===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Digital platforms and social media are essential for emerging artists to share their work globally, bypass traditional gallery constraints, and gain broader recognition.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les réseaux sociaux et les plateformes en ligne jouent également un rôle fundamental dans la diffusion de l’art. Ils permettent aux artistes d’atteindre un public mondial sans les contraintes des galeries traditionnelles..."
  - Location p6===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Support initiatives and alternative spaces enable artists to break free from conventions and experiment with new forms of expression, contributing to the dynamism of the French art scene.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Les initiatives de soutien à la création, ainsi que l’émergence d’espaces alternatifs, permettent aux artistes de s’affranchir des conventions et d’expérimenter de nouvelles formes d’expression."
  - Location p3===from https://mescoursdhistoire.fr/scene-artistique-francaise-contemporaine/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: French contemporary artists have limited recognition outside France, with only a few exceptions participating in major international biennials, resulting in lower market value compared to their American and German counterparts.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "À l’exception d’une poignée d’entre eux présents dans les grandes biennales internationales – tels que Kader Attia ou Pierre Huyghe –, les artistes français sont en effet quasi inconnus à l’étranger."
  - Location p4===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The lack of international recognition leads to lower prices for works by French contemporary artists, which discourages galleries from presenting them at major international art fairs.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Cette absence de notoriété se traduit par des prix inférieurs à ceux de leurs homologues étrangers, en particulier américains et allemands, ce qui incite d’autant moins les galeristes à présenter leurs œuvres dans les foires."
  - Location p4===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Historically, French collectors did not prioritize supporting French contemporary artists; instead, influential galleries and collectors showed stronger early support for German, British, and Italian art scenes.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "« Ils ont apporté un soutien fort et précoce aux scènes allemande (Joseph Beuys, Gerhard Richter, Ulrich Rückriem…), anglaise (John Hilliard, Barry Flanagan, David Tremlett…) et italienne (Alighiero Boetti, Jannis Kounellis, Mario Merz…), sans négliger pour autant le contexte français (Bertrand Lavier, Djamel Tatah, Gérard Garouste…) »"
  - Location p5===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: In recent years, some private initiatives and collectors have adopted a more active stance in promoting French contemporary artists through dedicated grants and exhibitions focused exclusively on the national scene.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Le Fonds de dotation Emerige, qu’il a créé, encourage les jeunes artistes de la scène française via la Bourse Révélations Emerige. Et cet automne, c’est sous le titre « Parade, une scène française », que le Mo.Co à Montpellier, expose une sélection d’œuvres d’une quarantaine d’artistes de sa collection..."
  - Location p5===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: French cultural institutions such as the Centre Pompidou are increasingly influenced by economic pressures, leading them to prioritize high-attendance exhibitions over showcasing mid-career French artists.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Or « la critique la plus courante faite aux responsables de musées comme le Centre Pompidou est que la programmation laisserait trop peu de place aux artistes en milieu de carrière de la scène française », note la galeriste Nathalie Obadia... la programmation des institutions est de plus en plus dépendante des enjeux économiques..."
  - Location p6===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Regional and national funding bodies in France provide significant support to the domestic art scene through acquisitions, commissions, and financial aid programs specifically targeting French artists and galleries.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "En région, les Fonds régionaux d’art contemporain jouent un rôle de soutien significatif à la scène française grâce à leurs achats... Quant au Centre national des arts plastiques... son volant d’actions, entre acquisitions, commandes et accompagnement de projets, constitue un soutien appréciable pour les galeries et les artistes français..."
  - Location p6===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: Specific awards and foundation-led initiatives aim to highlight and financially support French contemporary artists, contributing to their visibility within the national ecosystem.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "Parmi les nombreux dispositifs d’aides, on peut aussi mentionner le travail de fond mené depuis vingt-cinq ans par la Fondation Pernod Ricard, à travers son prix, qui récompense des artistes de la scène française. Ou celui de l’Association pour la diffusion internationale de l’art français (Adiaf), avec le prix Marcel-Duchamp, doté de 90 000 euros..."
  - Location p6===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.feature: The shift toward a more globalized and inclusive art world has led curators and institutions to prioritize diversity and sociocultural background, often at the expense of earlier French conceptual artists who are now overlooked.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Art and Ente.original:
- Quoted text "L’art conceptuel français des années 2000 est ainsi quasiment passé à la trappe... Les commissaires, les responsables d’institutions et les mécènes sont en effet plus attentifs aux questions de diversité et au parcours socioculturel des artistes qu’ils distinguent..."
  - Location p7===from https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/creation/art-contemporain-une-scene-francaise-entre-deux-eaux-173951

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Use formal language (e.g., "vous") when speaking to elders, professionals, or strangers unless invited to use informal terms; always use polite expressions like "Bonjour," "Merci," "S'il vous plaît," and "Au revoir," and address people as “Monsieur” or “Madame.”
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "First of all, always use formal language (address people via vous) when speaking to someone older than you or someone who has a higher rank in their profession. You should also use formal language when talking to strangers or people you don’t know well, unless they propose to move to the tu-basis."  
  - Location p4  

  - Quoted text "Polite formality also means using Bonjour, Merci, S'il vous plaît, and Au revoir whenever necessary, even with strangers. Address people as 'Monsieur' or 'Madame,' say 'Thank you' and 'You’re welcome' – and smile when doing it."  
  - Location p5  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Greet acquaintances and friends with light cheek kisses ("la bise") rather than hugs, following regional variations in number and starting side, and avoid hugging as it is considered too intimate.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Instead, the French greet each other with a light kiss on both cheeks, known as la bise."  
  - Location p6  

  - Quoted text "Hugging is considered too intimate for casual acquaintance, and long American greeting hugs can be seen as inappropriate in France. So make sure you stick to the cheek kisses when meeting someone for the first time or greeting someone you don’t know very well."  
  - Location p8  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Arriving 15 minutes late is acceptable for social events, and being punctual may result in waiting for others; meals are relaxed and not rushed.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "If there’s a certain hour set, it’s considered normal to arrive 15 minutes late, so if you come on time, you might end up waiting on your French dining partners for a bit."  
  - Location p9  

  - Quoted text "The French tend to take their time when eating, so don’t be in a hurry to finish your meal and leave. Instead, relax and enjoy the experience of savoring each course."  
  - Location p9  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Follow specific dining rules such as not starting to eat before everyone is served, keeping hands on the table, avoiding loud noises, refraining from negative comments about food, not snapping fingers or calling “garçon” to get service, and eating slowly.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Don’t start eating before everyone has a full glass in front of them. Wait to sit down until the host does so. Keep your hands on the table. No burping and no slurping. Never say you don’t like something – it’s one of the most important French table manners to comment only positively on the food. Don’t snap your fingers to call a waiter. (And don’t say garçon! either – French servers hate that.) Don’t pick your teeth, lick your knife or fork, or make food spots around you. Eat and drink slowly; don’t finish your glass in a gulp or your plate in two minutes."  
  - Location p10  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Refrain from asking personal questions such as age, income, or marital status when meeting someone new, as the French value privacy and consider such topics rude.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Don’t ask people you’ve just met personal questions – the French are very private. This means no talking about age, income, marital status, or even what the person did last weekend – these topics are considered quite rude and should be avoided."  
  - Location p11  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Discuss safe and acceptable subjects such as politics, art, food, culture, philosophy, architecture, and current events, while avoiding talk about money.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "There’s no small talk or personal discussions, so what should you talk about? Well, there are safe topics in France politics, art, and food. You can also talk about culture, philosophy, architecture, or popular events."  
  - Location p12  

  - Quoted text "The one thing you shouldn’t discuss is money – it’s not in the culture to do so, and this topic still remains a taboo."  
  - Location p12  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Avoid showing haste in social or professional interactions; the French value taking time to enjoy experiences and dislike being rushed.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "The French don’t believe in rushing through life, and they definitely don’t like being rushed by others."  
  - Location p13  

  - Quoted text "In France, it’s important to take your time and relax. Don’t be in a hurry to finish your meal or leave a social gathering, and don’t rush through things just to get them done."  
  - Location p14  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Leave a small tip (e.g., a few euros or 10%) for good service in restaurants and always tip tour guides, despite service being included in the bill.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Tipping is not mandatory in France, but it is appreciated, even though service is included in the bill. A good rule of thumb is to leave a few euros for good service. For example, you would leave 10% for a waiter in a restaurant... or a few cents for the taxi driver."  
  - Location p15  

  - Quoted text "One exception to this rule is that you should always tip a tour guide."  
  - Location p15  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Always close doors when entering or leaving public spaces or homes, including bathroom doors, as it marks boundaries between private and public areas.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "The French are very particular about closing doors – both inside and outside the house. If you’re in a public space, such as a restaurant or café, make sure to close the door when you enter or leave. The same goes for homes always close the front door when you come in and out."  
  - Location p16  

  - Quoted text "Closing doors is considered marking a boundary between private and public, so staying only in the rooms with open doors when visiting someone is considered proper French etiquette. Also, when you visit a bathroom, make sure to always close the door after you leave it."  
  - Location p16  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: When drinking wine, follow tasting etiquette (smell, swirl, sip), avoid criticizing the wine, leave the glass partially full to decline more, and do not bring wine to dinner parties to avoid insulting the host.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "When tasting wine, start by smelling the wine, then swirl the wine glass a bit, and then take a small sip to taste the flavors before swallowing."  
  - Location p17  

  - Quoted text "If you don’t like a certain type of wine, it’s best not to say anything – just like not saying anything negative about food."  
  - Location p17  

  - Quoted text "If you don’t want any more wine, leave your glass mostly full. It’s considered good French table manners to fill the empty glasses right away, so doing this small trick will allow you to avoid that."  
  - Location p17  

  - Quoted text "If you’re invited to a dinner party, don’t bring wine – instead, choose something like a box of chocolates or flowers (or, in casual settings, preparing a dish is also considered polite). Bringing your own wine is like saying that the host’s wine is not good enough for you."  
  - Location p17  

---===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Attempt to speak French when interacting in France, especially by using basic greetings; if needing to switch to English, politely ask permission first.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "But, even though they’ll probably understand you if you start speaking English, it’s considered polite to at least try to speak French when you’re in the country."  
  - Location p18  

  - Quoted text "If you don’t know any French, first ask for permission to switch to English by politely saying, 'Je ne parle pas français. Parlez-vous anglais?' ... Learning a few key phrases will be much appreciated."  
  - Location p18  

  - Quoted text "If you do know some French, make sure to use it – even if your level is not very high. Saying even a few French greetings will go a long way and show your interlocutors that you respect their language."  
  - Location p18===from https://readle-app.com/en/blog/french-etiquette-basics-10-things-you-need-to-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: It is mandatory to say "bonjour" when entering shops, cafes, or greeting strangers in public spaces, and after 6 PM, "bonsoir" should be used instead.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Saying bonjour, hello, is de rigeur when you meet strangers – and that goes for pretty much everywhere, bars, cafes, the street, shops. After 6pm, generally, it’s bonsoir, good evening."  
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: One should always use formal titles such as "Monsieur" or "Madame" when addressing men and women, especially older individuals, until invited to use first names.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "And always use 'Monsieur' for men and 'Madame' for women – especially for older people or until you’re invited to use first names. It shows respect and an understanding of French formality in relationships."  
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: At a meal hosted by someone else, it is impolite to begin eating before the host or hostess starts.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "if you’ve been invited to a restaurant or you’re at someone’s house for dinner, you should never start to eat before your host or hostess."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: It is considered impolite to begin drinking before a toast, and during the toast, one should look the person in the eye while raising their glass and say “santé.”
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "it’s considered impolite to begin drinking before a toast – and you should look the person in the eye when you’re raising your glass to them and say 'santé' – good health – or else you might get 7 years of bad luck."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: While dining, hands should remain on the table rather than in the lap.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "in France it’s customary to keep your hands on the table rather than in your lap"  
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Bread should be placed directly on the table (not upside down) and torn into pieces by hand rather than cut with a knife.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "bread is placed on the table or tablecloth generally not a plate (and NOT upside down – it’s bad luck). [...] You should tear pieces off the bread, not slice it"  
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: To get a server's attention, one should make eye contact, raise an arm slightly, or politely say "monsieur" or "madame" with "s’il vous plait," rather than shouting or whistling.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Basically, catch the server’s eye as they pass, or raise your arm when they’re looking your way, mouth sil vous plait if they are a bit far away for shouting, or just say monsieur, madame, s’il vous plait if they are in hearing distance and you’re not interrupting them talking to another diner."  
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Discussing personal topics such as salary or requesting a tour of someone’s home is considered inappropriate and violates social etiquette.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "you’ll never get French visitors coming around for drinks and asking you how much you earn or requesting a look around your house which would be perfectly normal in the UK where I am from. In fact don’t talk about money much at all – that’s etiquette in France"  
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: The choice between using "tu" (informal) and "vous" (formal) is governed by social etiquette and once established, changing from "vous" to "tu" without mutual agreement is considered improper.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "his mum met her next-door neighbour, they called each other ‘vous’ [...] But somehow, they never got onto calling each other ‘tu’, despite passing each other in the street most weeks and stopping to chat. And now, it’s too late his mum can’t suddenly call her neighbour ‘tu’. It wouldn’t seem right!"  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://thegoodlifefrance.com/guide-to-french-etiquette-everything-you-should-know/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: It is considered polite to arrive 10 to 15 minutes after the scheduled time when invited to dinner in France, as it gives the host extra time to prepare and avoids making them feel rushed.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "En France, arriver 10 à 15 minutes après l'heure du rendez-vous quand on est invité à dîner peut être un petit geste de convivialité. Cela donne à l'hôte un peu de temps supplémentaire pour peaufiner les derniers détails, et ça évite d'être trop pressé ou stressé."
  - Location p23===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: As a host, it is courteous to offer to take guests’ coats upon arrival to help them feel comfortable and to create a relaxed atmosphere from the start.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "En tant qu'hôte, c'est toujours sympa de proposer à vos invités de débarrasser leurs manteaux dès leur arrivée. C'est un petit geste qui montre que vous vous occupez d'eux et que vous voulez qu'ils se sentent tout de suite à l'aise."
  - Location p25===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: In France, it is common for hosts to ask guests to remove their shoes upon entering, especially in homes with carpets, as a sign of respect and to maintain cleanliness.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "En France, il n'est pas rare qu'en tant qu'invité, on nous demande de nous déchausser en entrant chez quelqu'un. Cette pratique peut surprendre si on n'y est pas habitué, mais elle fait partie de certaines traditions, notamment dans les foyers où le sol est recouvert de tapis. Se déchausser est vu comme un geste de respect envers la maison et l'hôte, et cela permet de préserver l'hygiène et le confort à l'intérieur."
  - Location p26===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: When invited to a meal, it is appropriate to bring a small gift such as dessert, drinks, chocolates, flowers, or a bottle of champagne, even if the host says nothing is needed, as it shows appreciation and willingness to contribute.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Quand on est invité à un repas et qu'on se demande si on doit apporter quelque chose, une bonne façon de gérer l'inquiétude est de simplement proposer d'amener un dessert ou une boisson. [...] Si l'hôte répond qu'il ne faut rien apporter, n'hésitez pas à venir avec un petit cadeau, selon l'occasion. Par exemple, une boîte de chocolats d'un chocolatier que vous aimez, un bouquet de fleurs avec une poche d'eau, une bouteille de champagne bien frais, ou même un petit objet attentionné."
  - Location p22===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: In France, it is customary to toast before drinking, which involves raising one’s glass, making eye contact, and not crossing glasses, as a symbolic gesture of connection, respect, and goodwill.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Trinquer avant de boire est une tradition qui a une signification symbolique importante. En France, comme dans de nombreuses cultures, lever son verre et trinquer avec quelqu'un avant de boire est un geste qui marque l'échange et le lien entre les personnes présentes. [...] Pour trinquer, il faut regarder l'autre dans les yeux et ne pas croiser les verres !"
  - Location p28===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: It is acceptable and appreciated to give positive comments about the food during a meal, especially if the host prepared it, but negative remarks should be avoided unless among very close friends.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "En France, il est tout à fait courant de commenter le repas pendant le dîner, et cela se fait généralement de manière positive. Si vous trouvez le plat délicieux, n'hésitez pas à le dire (surtout si vous savez que votre hôte l'a cuisiné lui-même) ! [...] Par contre, il est préférable d'éviter les remarques négatives pendant le repas, sauf si vous êtes vraiment très proche de l'hôte et que vous vous sentez à l'aise de le faire de manière constructive."
  - Location p29===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: During formal dinners, it is proper etiquette to keep hands on the table (but not elbows), as it appears more refined and respectful.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Lors d'un dîner mondain, il y a quelques petites règles à suivre pour rester élégant à table. Par exemple, on évite de poser ses coudes sur la table, mais on garde les mains posées dessus, ça paraît plus soigné."
  - Location p30===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Using or leaving a mobile phone on the table during a meal is considered extremely impolite, as it suggests disrespect toward the host and other guests; attention should remain on conversation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Répondre au téléphone ou consulter des messages pendant le dîner est considéré comme extrêmement malpoli, surtout lorsqu'on est invité chez quelqu'un. Cela peut donner l'impression que vous n'accordez pas d'importance à l'hôte ou aux autres convives, et cela brise l'ambiance conviviale du repas."
  - Location p32===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: At formal meals, diners should begin with the utensils placed farthest from the plate and work inward, following established table etiquette.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Et pour les couverts, on commence toujours par ceux qui sont placés le plus loin de l'assiette. C'est un peu formel, mais c'est un moyen de respecter l'étiquette tout en gardant une certaine fluidité pendant le repas."
  - Location p30===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Guests should wait for the host to start eating or drinking before beginning themselves, as a sign of respect and to foster a convivial atmosphere.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Il est courant, en France, d'attendre que l'hôte commence à manger ou à boire avant de se servir à table, par respect pour lui et pour instaurer une certaine convivialité."
  - Location p28===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: It is recommended to use the bathroom before sitting down for a meal to avoid interrupting the conversation and disrupting the flow of the gathering.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Un petit conseil pratique  pensez à passer aux toilettes avant de passer à table ! [...] Ça montre aussi un peu de respect pour les autres convives et pour l'hôte, en évitant de couper la conversation ou de déranger l'ambiance."
  - Location p33===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: Speaking with a full mouth, eating with an open mouth, or leaning too closely over one’s plate should be avoided, especially during formal or hosted meals, to maintain politeness and comfort for others.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
- Quoted text "Parler la bouche pleine, manger avec la bouche ouverte ou se pencher trop sur son assiette, ce sont des petites choses qu'on essaie d'éviter, surtout en repas un peu formels ou quand on est invité."
  - Location p34===from https://www.novexpat.com/fr/culture-francaise/etiquette-a-la-francaise-et-savoir-vivre-a-table

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.feature: After attending a dinner or event, it is appropriate to send a thank-you message the next day via phone, text, or written note to express gratitude and reinforce social bonds.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Etiquette an.original:
