Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Understanding French idioms is essential for better appreciation of the language and effective communication with native speakers, helping to prevent misunderstandings.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "One way to appreciate the French language better is by getting a grasp of its most popular idioms. It will help you understand the language better and communicate with native speakers. It will also prevent any misunderstandings if you converse with the locals there."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://journeytofrance.com/french-idioms/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Idiomatic expressions are commonly used in spoken French to convey ideas, emotions, or situations in a vivid and often humorous way, enriching communication through imagery.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Une expression populaire est une tournure de phrase imagée ou figurée utilisée couramment dans la langue parlée pour exprimer une idée de manière vivante, drôle ou percutante."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Idiomatic expressions in French should not be interpreted literally, as they rely on metaphors and shared cultural references to convey meaning.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ces expressions ne doivent pas toujours être prises au sens littéral, car elles utilisent des métaphores ou des références culturelles partagées."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idioms are deeply rooted in the country's history and traditions, forming part of the oral and cultural heritage of francophone communities.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les expressions populaires, souvent appelées 'idiomes' ou 'tournures idiomatiques', sont des phrases ou des expressions figées dans la langue française, chargées de sens culturel et souvent colorées par l'histoire et les traditions."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Idioms add color to language and allow speakers to express complex ideas concisely by relying on easily visualized images.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ces expressions donnent de la couleur au langage et permettent de dire beaucoup avec peu de mots, en s’appuyant sur des images faciles à visualiser."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The use of idiomatic expressions in French can vary depending on region or generation, and they evolve over time.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Elles évoluent avec le temps et varient parfois selon les régions ou les générations ..."  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idioms frequently use body parts metaphorically to express emotions, actions, or states of being, such as using "head," "tongue," "feet," and "eyes" in figurative expressions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "faire la tête — to sulk ('to do the head')"
  - Location p1

- Rule Description The head is commonly used in idioms to represent mental or emotional control, effort, or burden.
- ===from https://www.omniglot.com/language/idioms/french.php

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idioms often incorporate food items or common household objects metaphorically to describe situations, behaviors, or conditions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "pédaler dans la semoule — to go round in circles / to get nowhere fast ('to pedal in the semolina')"
  - Location p1
- ===from https://www.omniglot.com/language/idioms/french.php

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idiomatic expressions use animals and natural elements to symbolize human traits or experiences.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "avoir les dent longues — to be ambitious; to have lofty goals ('to have long teeth')"
  - Location p1
- ===from https://www.omniglot.com/language/idioms/french.php

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idioms are often constructed with literal imagery that reflects cultural attitudes, and their direct translations reveal distinct metaphors compared to English equivalents.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "casser les pieds à quelqu’un — to get on someone's nerves ('to break someone's feet')"
  - Location p1
- ===from https://www.omniglot.com/language/idioms/french.php

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used to indicate that something will never happen, emphasizing impossibility.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It is used to say that something will never ever happen."
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used when someone wants to clarify an issue by adding more details, making things explicitly clear.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone wants to make things clear by adding more details about an issue or subject."
  - Location paragraph 8===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression conveys that an action or speech is completely useless and ineffective.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This French idiomatic expression means that the action or speech is useless and has no efficiency since peeing in a violin won’t produce anything."
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used either when someone celebrates overcoming a non-existent difficulty or when stating something obvious as if it were a new discovery.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "The second use of the expression is when someone is trying to demonstrate something obvious, stating a banality by presenting it as a discovery."
  - Location paragraph 10===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to someone forcing themselves to laugh despite being upset, often to avoid embarrassing the speaker.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone is forcing himself to laugh... The yellow laugh can also be used when a person does not want the speaker to be embarrassed about his speech."
  - Location paragraph 11===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes hypocrisy—someone mocking another for a flaw they themselves possess.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Someone who makes fun of a default of another person, who himself has. There is an irony in this idiom, a certain sarcasm that fits perfectly with French culture/humor."
  - Location paragraph 12===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression warns against assuming success before it actually happens.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "A person should not take for granted a thing that is not yet in his possession."
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes an action that is very easy to perform.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This expression designs an action that is easy to make."
  - Location paragraph 14===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used to describe extremely cold weather.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "An idiom used to express that the weather is pretty cold."
  - Location paragraph 15===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means one should not judge someone based solely on their appearance.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "By making assumptions by the look of a person, you might be wrong."
  - Location paragraph 16===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression indicates being in the same difficult situation as someone else.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It means to be in the same difficult situation as someone else."
  - Location paragraph 17===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression criticizes acting illogically or out of proper order.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person does not act in a logical way."
  - Location paragraph 18===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to accomplishing something through hard physical work and effort.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This expression is for an action that can be done with motivation and physical exercise. In other words, it evokes the energy to devote to a work requiring effort."
  - Location paragraph 19===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means to criticize someone who is not present.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It means to criticize someone that is not present."
  - Location paragraph 20===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to insincere, vague, or evasive speech that avoids addressing real issues.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "The expression qualifies as a speech devoid of reality, which does not answer the problem posed. The message communicated by the speaker is intentionally fake."
  - Location paragraph 21===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used to describe an action that is easy, requires no effort, or involves no risk.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "A French idiom to express that an action is easy to make or it does not require great expense or effort... there are no risks in doing it."
  - Location paragraph 22===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes overestimating one’s capacity, especially in consuming more than one can handle.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Overestimating his capability to do an action. The French expression is mostly used when someone orders too much food and cannot finish it in the end."
  - Location paragraph 23===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to a final event that triggers an emotional outburst after a series of accumulated frustrations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It refers to an over-the-top situation, a situation that has crossed the line... a word or action that will provoke an explosion of anger."
  - Location paragraph 24===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes someone who is idle or doing nothing productive.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It means that the person is lazy and doing nothing at all just using his hands for a useless activity."
  - Location paragraph 25===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression indicates tension or conflict in a relationship or situation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "An idiom that describes a situation with some tension. It is used when there is a clash, an argument in a couple, for example."
  - Location paragraph 26===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression criticizes wanting both benefits simultaneously without accepting trade-offs.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "An idiom that expresses the fact that someone wants everything with only the pros and not the cons."
  - Location paragraph 27===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used when someone feels ignored or treated as unimportant.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone is being ignored, not given importance."
  - Location paragraph 28===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means improving one’s financial or living conditions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It means that the person manages to improve his living conditions and earn more money."
  - Location paragraph 29===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression indicates there is no urgency; something can wait.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "There is no need to rush, it can wait for later."
  - Location paragraph 30===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes being indecisive or torn between two choices.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Being torn between two situations, not knowing what to choose, simply having a dilemma."
  - Location paragraph 31===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means to forcefully extract information from someone reluctant to speak.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This expression means to get someone to talk."
  - Location paragraph 32===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression indicates being completely mistaken or wrong.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It is when a person is grossly mistaken."
  - Location paragraph 33===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to rejecting or spoiling something beneficial; often used negatively as “don’t spit in the soup” to accept opportunities.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Spitting in it, therefore, meant refusing something that was perceived as beneficial. You might hear more often the negative version of the expression with 'don’t spit in the soup' meaning that the person won’t miss an opportunity."
  - Location paragraph 34===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes being overly critical or nitpicky, looking for minor flaws.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It is when a person is trying hard to discover an error and/or being picky."
  - Location paragraph 35===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes someone acting pretentiously or above their station.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person acts in a pretentious way and feels very important."
  - Location paragraph 36===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means something is very simple or easy to do.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "The equivalent in English would be 'It’s easy as pie'. This French idiom came from the observation of greeting someone. Saying 'Hello' to someone is associated with the idea of an act of great simplicity."
  - Location paragraph 37===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means something is the least of one’s concerns or worries.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "A French expression that would be translated into English to 'The least of my worries'."
  - Location paragraph 38===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes someone living comfortably and enjoying life.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It means that this person is having a good life."
  - Location paragraph 39===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression refers to abruptly changing topics without logical connection.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person changes the topic of the conversation with no whatsoever link to the previous one."
  - Location paragraph 40===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means changing one’s opinion or position on a matter.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person changes his mind, his opinion about a subject."
  - Location paragraph 41===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means a situation is far from resolved and remains complicated.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Something that is complicated to be done."
  - Location paragraph 42===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means doing something with great energy or intensity.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person does act with a lot of energy. The 'dead hand' actually symbolizes an inactive or powerless hand."
  - Location paragraph 43===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means failing to show up for an appointment or standing someone up.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Nowadays, it means refusing, and no-showing at a meeting."
  - Location paragraph 44===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means accomplishing something easily and effortlessly.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Achieve an action without difficulty and without effort."
  - Location paragraph 46===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression assumes that absence of news implies that nothing bad has occurred.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "If we don’t hear from someone, we can assume that nothing bad has happened to them."
  - Location paragraph 47===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means the potential reward justifies the effort or risk involved.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "In English, it would be a 'simple' expression with 'It’s worth the risk'."
  - Location paragraph 48===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes experiencing sudden disappointment or a harsh surprise.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person experiences a sudden disappointment, a bad surprise."
  - Location paragraph 49===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means having a lot of work to do.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person has some work to do."
  - Location paragraph 50===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression indicates not feeling well physically or emotionally.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "An expression that means to be in a bad mood or not feeling well."
  - Location paragraph 51===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression is used when someone appears just as they are being talked about.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This expression is used when someone appears when he or she was the heart of the conversation."
  - Location paragraph 52===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes clumsily bringing up a sensitive or inappropriate topic.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone clumsily approached a subject to be avoided without realizing it."
  - Location paragraph 53===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means aging or gaining experience, often with a positive connotation of improvement.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone starts to age, gains experience, meaning the person became better."
  - Location paragraph 54===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression describes doing something with great care and attention.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When someone does an action with a lot of care, with a lot of attention."
  - Location paragraph 55===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: This expression means failing to notice what is actually happening, often due to being deceived or distracted.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "When a person doesn’t notice anything. The person is dazzled by the light and cannot see anything."
  - Location paragraph 56===from https://french-iceberg.com/french-idiomatic-expressions/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Popular expressions in French are figurative phrases commonly used in informal speech to convey ideas, emotions, or situations in a vivid and often humorous way, forming part of the country's oral and cultural heritage.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Une expression populaire est une phrase imagée, souvent métaphorique, utilisée couramment dans le langage familier pour exprimer une idée, une émotion ou une situation de manière vivante et souvent humoristique. Elle fait partie du patrimoine oral et culturel d’un pays."  
  - Location p4===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French popular expressions rely heavily on metaphors and shared cultural references rather than literal meanings, allowing speakers to communicate complex ideas succinctly through imagery.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ces expressions ne doivent pas toujours être prises au sens littéral, car elles utilisent des métaphores ou des références culturelles partagées."  
  - Location p3===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French idiomatic expressions reflect the linguistic richness and cultural diversity of the Francophone world, evolving over time and varying by region or generation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Elles enrichissent la communication en offrant des façons imagées et expressives de partager des idées et des émotions, tout en reflétant la richesse linguistique et la diversité culturelle de la francophonie."  
  - Location p2===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Popular French expressions change over time and may differ depending on geographical regions or generational usage.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Elles évoluent avec le temps et varient parfois selon les régions ou les générations ..."  
  - Location p5===from https://longuetraine.fr/index.php?article1622/les-100-expressions-les-plus-populaires-de-la-langue-francaise-decodees-pour-vous

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Appearances can be misleading, and one should not judge a person’s character or sincerity based solely on their outward appearance.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "The phrase implies that appearances can sometimes mislead one’s better judgment. The English equivalent would be, 'Don’t judge a book by its cover.'"  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: When outcomes are uncertain, it is best to wait and see what happens rather than making assumptions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Something is unknown now, but will become clear in the future; the only way to find out is to wait and see."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Each individual prioritizes their own perspective and interests, which influences how they interact with others and make decisions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Each person prioritizes their own interests, and their unique perspective on life guides how they interact with others, set goals, work and live."  
  - Location paragraph 3===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Preventive action is more effective and preferable than dealing with problems after they occur, especially regarding health.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "It’s better to take the necessary precautions to prevent a sickness, than to have to treat and heal this sickness."  
  - Location paragraph 4===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: In life, lack of progress leads to regression; continuous effort and adaptation are necessary to avoid stagnation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "There can be no standstill in life, only evolution or devolution. You can either adapt, or become stagnant and 'recede.'"  
  - Location paragraph 5===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: One should not trust surface-level impressions, as appearances can be deceptive and may not reflect reality.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This saying is the English equivalent of 'You can’t judge a book by its cover,' or 'Looks can be deceiving.' It means that you should get to know someone before you make judgments about them."  
  - Location paragraph 6===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Patience and consistent small efforts over time lead to meaningful accomplishments.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "This proverb designates patience and perseverance."

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Balanced relationships, especially financial ones, contribute to lasting friendships.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Children are expected to behave quietly and obediently, resembling passive images.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Events described as happening “when chickens have teeth” are sarcastically referred to as never occurring.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Leaving a position or seat unattended risks losing it, emphasizing vigilance in maintaining one’s status.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Contradictory statements from a person undermine their credibility and consistency.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Conciseness is valued in communication, and summarizing avoids unnecessary elaboration.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The impulse to engage in dangerous or reckless behavior, even when aware of consequences, is recognized as a psychological phenomenon.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: False modesty or guilt-driven good behavior is acknowledged, though it may not always reflect genuine humility.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Acting with maximum speed or urgency is expressed using imagery from horse riding.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "You can use this phrase to say that someone is doing something at full speed or really quickly."

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Despite apparent changes, underlying realities remain constant, reflecting a resigned acceptance of continuity.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Accomplishing tasks under difficulty, even imperfectly, is still recognized as an effort worth acknowledging.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Hobbies are valued as personal pursuits outside professional obligations, rooted in historical cultural reference.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Midlife crises, often involving drastic personal changes such as leaving a spouse, are culturally acknowledged.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:

  - Location paragraph 59===from https://www.fluentu.com/blog/french/french-sayings/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Women are stereotypically blamed as the root cause of complex problems, reflecting a sexist cultural trope.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "The cause of the situation/problem must be a woman. This is a sexist saying... in which women are blamed for being at the heart of most troubles."

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Staying focused on the main topic is encouraged, especially in formal discussions where digressions occur.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Partial resolution of a problem does not mean full success; continued effort is still required.

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Proverbs are considered essential elements of the French language and culture, serving as valuable carriers of popular wisdom that are passed down through generations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les proverbes occupent une place essentielle dans la langue française."  
  - Location paragraph 7===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Proverbs are used to transmit practical advice and life lessons from one generation to the next, encapsulating collective experiences and time-tested observations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les proverbes sont utilisés pour transmettre des leçons de vie et des conseils pratiques d’une génération à l’autre."  
  - Location paragraph 9===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The proverb “Petit à petit, l’oiseau fait son nid” reflects a cultural value placed on patience and steady effort, teaching that significant achievements result from continuous small actions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ce proverbe met en avant l’importance de la patience et de la persévérance. Il suggère que les grandes réalisations se construisent progressivement."  
  - Location paragraph 14===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The proverb “L’habit ne fait pas le moine” illustrates a cultural skepticism toward superficial appearances and emphasizes the importance of inner qualities over external presentation.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Il s’agit d’une expression qui rappelle qu’il ne faut pas juger les gens sur leurs apparences. L’essentiel réside dans les qualités internes et les actions d’une personne, et non dans son apparence extérieure."  
  - Location paragraph 17===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The proverb “Qui ne risque rien n’a rien” reflects a cultural belief that taking initiative and calculated risks is necessary for achieving rewards or success.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Cette phrase souligne l’importance de prendre des risques pour réussir. Il indique que sans initiative ou prise de risque, on ne peut espérer obtenir de récompenses ou d’avantages."  
  - Location paragraph 15===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The proverb “Mieux vaut tard que jamais” conveys a cultural preference for completing tasks even if delayed, valuing action and accomplishment regardless of timing.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Cette expression incite à ne pas abandonner même si on est en retard. Il vaut mieux accomplir quelque chose avec retard que de ne jamais le faire."  
  - Location paragraph 18===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The proverb “Chassez le naturel, il revient au galop” reflects a cultural understanding that inherent traits or deep habits inevitably resurface despite attempts to suppress or change them.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ce proverbe souligne que les traits de caractère innés ou les habitudes profondes reviennent toujours, même si l’on essaie de les changer ou de les masquer."  
  - Location paragraph 19===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Proverbs are used as pedagogical tools in education to teach moral values and ethical concepts, helping students reflect on real-life situations and develop critical thinking.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les proverbes sont des outils pédagogiques puissants. Ils sont utilisés dans l’enseignement pour transmettre des leçons de vie et des valeurs morales."  
  - Location paragraph 23===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Proverbs serve as expressions of cultural identity and contribute to social cohesion by transmitting shared traditions, beliefs, and accepted behaviors within French-speaking communities.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les proverbes sont des vecteurs de la culture et des valeurs d’une société. Ils transmettent des traditions, des croyances et des comportements acceptés. Ils contribuent ainsi à la cohésion culturelle et à l’identité collective."  
  - Location paragraph 22===from https://www.lacourseauxmots.com/2024/06/06/proverbes-francais/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: French cultural wisdom is transmitted through proverbs that encapsulate life lessons, often derived from popular tradition, and are used to convey universal truths in a concise and memorable way.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les proverbes français sont des expressions riches en sagesse et en enseignements, souvent issus de la tradition populaire."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://lecoursgratuit.com/liste-des-proverbes-francais-les-plus-connus/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Proverbs are used as practical tools to offer guidance in everyday situations, reflecting values such as patience, caution, perseverance, and resilience.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ces proverbes français sont autant de conseils de vie et de sagesse populaire, parfois formulés avec poésie ou humour."  
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://lecoursgratuit.com/liste-des-proverbes-francais-les-plus-connus/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: There is a cultural preference for expressing complex human experiences and moral lessons through simple, poetic, or figurative language that is easy to remember and share.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ils capturent l’expérience humaine dans des tournures simples mais profondes, et aident à transmettre des leçons de manière concise et mémorable."  
  - Location paragraph 13===from https://lecoursgratuit.com/liste-des-proverbes-francais-les-plus-connus/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The French value accumulated experience as a key source of wisdom and personal development, emphasizing learning through practice.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ces proverbes sont des rappels de la sagesse collective et des leçons de vie qui restent pertinents, peu importe l’époque ou le lieu."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Perseverance is considered an important cultural trait in France, reflected in the belief that persistence leads to success.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Ils montrent l’importance de l’expérience, de la prudence et de la persévérance dans la culture française."  
  - Location paragraph 2===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The French appreciate gradual, steady progress toward goals rather than rushed or immediate results.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Petit à petit, l’oiseau fait son nid.” – Les grandes réalisations se font progressivement."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: A past negative experience is seen as justification for increased caution in similar future situations.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Chat échaudé craint l’eau froide.” – Une mauvaise expérience peut rendre très prudent."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: It is considered wiser to take preventive action before problems arise than to deal with them afterward.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Il vaut mieux prévenir que guérir.” – Il est plus sage de prévenir les problèmes que de devoir les résoudre ensuite."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Taking time, especially sleeping on it, is valued as a way to make better decisions.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "La nuit porte conseil.” – Prendre une décision après une nuit de réflexion est souvent une bonne idée."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: The idea that something is “impossible” is culturally rejected, reflecting a mindset of determination and resilience.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Impossible n’est pas français.” – Les Français sont réputés pour ne jamais abandonner."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: Maintaining clear and prompt financial settlements is seen as essential for preserving friendships.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Les bons comptes font les bons amis.” – Régler clairement et rapidement les questions d’argent préserve l’amitié."  
  - Location paragraph 1===from https://www.orientaction-groupe.com/vingt-proverbes-francais-marquants-citations-auteurs-esprit-philosophes-sagessse-pensees-dictons-paroles/

Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.feature: New words or expressions (neologisms) are created in French to name novel concepts, especially those arising from technological, social, or cultural changes, ensuring the language remains relevant and expressive.
Personal_Choices_and_Habits-Fixed Expres.original:
- Quoted text "Exprimer des concepts nouveaux  L’apparition de nouvelles technologies ou pratiques sociales nécessite des mots pour les nommer."  
  - Location p5  

- Rule Description Abbreviations or condensed forms are used in French to simplify communication by encapsulating complex ideas into single terms, enhancing efficiency in expression.  
- ===from https://langueetlitteraturefrancaises.com/2025/01/25/les-neologismes-une-evolution-linguistique-en-marche/
